Recommandé
8.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2021
Уютная головоломка от первого лица, где ты делаешь так, чтобы мир расцвел.

The Unfinished Swan рассказывает добрую историю о том, как мальчик исследует истории нескольких сказочных королевств. Процесс недолог, даже со сбором предметов хватит четырех часов, чтобы все увидеть.

Не все элементы тут собираются воедино, чувствуется, что игра была экспериментальной для ее создателей. И все же визуальная составляющая решает.

Мне зашла The Unfinished Swan, потому что для ее прохождения не нужно прилагать титанических усилий. Поэтому я закрыл глаза на то, что она могла быть более продуманной в некоторых моментах.

Прошел на PS4, здесь взял, чтобы заново вернуться через много лет.
 
Solid Pandolini
1,750 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2021
Думали ли вы когда-нибудь о том, что мир можно... нарисовать? Превратить белый холст в черно-белую картину, или заставить садовую фигуру улететь в небеса, или по мановению руки создать лестницу?..
Лезть по вьюнкам над пропастью... Романтика! 
Une capture d'écran de The Unfinished Swan
Par : Аннаэйра

Все, кто любил в детстве стрелять воздушными шариками с краской — вперед!
Творческая и креативная страница Куратора 👉🏼YroMIR ReviewS👈🏼 ждет вас. Подпишитесь! Поддержите качество на просторах Steam. Приятного ознакомления!
ПЛЮСЫ

Что-то это мне напоминает... 
Une capture d'écran de The Unfinished Swan
Par : Аннаэйра

  • Оригинальный дизайн. Пожалуй, главный плюс игры: вряд ли где-нибудь еще вы проведете несколько часов, забрызгивая краской все доступные поверхности. :) Что приятно, в каждой главе смысл этого действа немного меняется: поначалу шарики нужны просто для ориентации в пространстве, затем — для того, чтобы прокладывать «вьюнковые дороги», затем — чтобы толкать и пихать светящиеся шарики... В общем, не сильно заскучаешь.
  • Милая сказка. Хотя из такой игры можно было бы слепить просто незабываемый хоррор, «Unfinished Swan» — это просто история ради истории, маленькое путешествие по нарисованным мирам. Умереть тут сложновато (кроме утопления героя еще могут закусать пауки, но с ними мы сталкиваемся лишь в одной из глав), прыгает мальчик Монро как лягушонок, а дальнейший путь, хоть и не всегда очевиден, часто отмечен золотыми «указателями» — трубами, лестницами... отпечатками лебединых лап.
  • Поиск шариков не бесполезен. В игре можно собирать своеобразные «коллекционные предметы» — разноцветные воздушные шарики, которых на уровне определенное количество. Для некоторых игроков собрать все шарики было бы уже само по себе наградой... но разработчики пошли дальше и прикрутили особую возможность — мини-магазинчик. В нем, например, можно приобрести способность очищать окружающее пространство от краски (полезно на первых уровнях, когда черной краской все можно замазать до предела!) или «чуять» несобранные шарики (доступно только после полного прохождения игры). Ну, и сборник эскизов приобрести тоже не помешает. ;)
  • Приятное звуковое наполнение. Музыка в игре довольно спокойная, звуковые эффекты тоже не режут уши, а озвучка персонажей (на русском языке!) выполнена весьма достойно. В общем, отдых для моих ушек.

МИНУСЫ

Запущенные в воду шарики краски становятся рыбьим кормом. :) 
Une capture d'écran de The Unfinished Swan
Par : Аннаэйра
  • Игра короткая. В принципе, ее можно пройти часа за два, особенно если не сильно заморачиваться сбором всяких там шариков и поиском пропущенных страниц из сказки (хотя я собрала все с первого захода). Так что, если бы не скидка, я бы на игру вряд ли позарилась.
  • Игра довольно коридорная. В игре предельно мало каких-то ответвлений и необязательных комнат, так что, впервые попав в заплетенный вьюнками обеденный зал и не увидев очевидного выхода, я поначалу чуть ли не визжала от восторга... но потом оказалось, что попасть в предыдущую локацию, забравшись вверх по зеленой стене, нереально, а выход-таки есть — через камин. Ощутила разочарование...

ИТОГО

В целом получилась необычная и довольно интересная игра, на которую не жаль было потратить несколько часов. Столь же сильного впечатления, как «What remains of Edith Finch», она на меня не произвела, но приятное впечатление оставила. За что я ей и благодарна.

Общая оценка: ХОРОШО
 
Аннаэйра
3
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2021
What a delightful experience.

The Unfinished Swan is a first person, puzzle-walking simulator hybrid, where objects only take shape after you splash them with a glob of black paint. The ink only provides a rudimentary outline for the game world, and it is up to the player to navigate their way through this weird monochromatic world. This however is just the first chapter and subsequent ones switch up things quite a bit. They have their moments, but none are as interesting as the first thirty minutes of this game.

Because the game is so very short - two, maybe three hours long - no one stage lasts long enough to wear out its conceptual welcome. As soon as a puzzle concept becomes tedious, Swan switches things up, sometimes really dramatically.

Worth picking up. Too bad its brilliant concept wasn't pushed further.
 
Moralio
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2020
As a big fan of What Remains of Edith Finch (one of the best games I played in 2018) I was thrilled to finally get a chance to start playing The Unfinished Swan (which had been a Playstation exclusive for years). While it is unfortunately not a great as Edith Finch, I still had fun playing through this short puzzle game. I especially enjoyed the first hour, where the mechanic of throwing paint at the level to find your way around was still new and exciting. There are some small variations to the mechanic and I enjoyed all of them (although the darker levels were a bit hard to navigate and I am not a big fan of jumping in 3D puzzle games). Overall, a very decent puzzle game by Giant Sparrow (which is swiftly turning into one of my favorite developers!) with some great storytelling. 7/10
 
FreakFire74

Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2020
個人的に『フィンチ家』はめちゃくちゃ響いたので、”『フィンチ家の奇妙な屋敷でおきたこと（What Remains of Edith Finch）』の開発チームから新着！”という販促文につられて購入しました。

メインストーリーをすべて終わらせた時点でレビューを書いています。

ゲーム体験もプレーヤー自身も、初めはなにもわからないところからスタートするのは『フィンチ家』と似ていますね。
そこから、だれかの足跡を辿っていくことでストーリーが進み、ぼんやりと全体が見えてきつつも、謎が残る部分も似ている。

ストーリーは、子供の夢見のようになかなか突飛な印象をうけました。
それは別に悪いことではないんですが、思うところは少なかったです。

せっかくの「描く」(というより汚す...)要素が、後半はほぼ形骸化しているのもちょっと残念でしたが、『フィンチ家』同様、良い意味で「見る」ゲームだと思うので、まあいいんでしょうか。

ゲーム自体も一本道ですし、（まだ隠しコンテンツには手を付けてないので）大声では言えないですが、1500円が見合っているかといわれると、うーんって感じですね。それでも高すぎるとは思わないですが。ギミック付きの大体3時間読める絵本にいくら払えるか、でしょうか。
 
okiami

22 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3
Non recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2021
The Unfinished Swan
The Ugly Duckling has become a beautiful but hollow Swan

The Good
+ Very nice and relaxing atmosphere, especially the first level
+ Interesting mechanics

The Bad
- Playtime you get for the price is just way too short
- Puzzles can’t really be called puzzles, more like small obstacles
- Mechanics come down to simply mashing your mouse button
- Story is extremely simplistic/childish

Verdict: Only buy this game if it’s on sale AND you’re confident you’ll enjoy it based on the trailer and pictures. If you’re only slightly interested to see what this game offers, you might end up disappointed. The latter was unfortunately my case.

______________________________________________________________

In-depth review
Let me start off by saying that I don’t think this is a bad game. It’s pretty decent, but the negatives make it a very underwhelming experience. Especially for its price tag which makes the game even at a sale barely worth it (considering game time you get in return). Allow me to elaborate a bit more on some important aspects:

Atmosphere
This is probably the strongest point of this game. If the store page in Steam has peaked your interest, it is probably because of the idea of painting the invisible world around your character. At least, that is what caught my eye. And boy, that first level was a magnificent experience. Something I had never really witnessed in a game. Starting out in a completely blank canvas, it is you job to find your way through the world while throwing balls of black paint. It allows for very interesting and unique scenery. Combine that with a relaxing soundtrack and this level alone might be one of the things I’m going to remember for a long time.

Unfortunately, this level takes about 15 minutes (maybe less) to finish and then shades are added to the canvas. Buildings, trees and other objects are now visible on their own. This is where the game goes slightly downhill for me, since the unique mechanic of painting the world around you just becomes kind of obsolete. At this point, you’re just dealing with a very simplistic, albeit beautiful, walking simulator with some very sorry excuses the developers thought were puzzles. Yes, more mechanics will be added as your journey proceeds, but none felt as great as the one introduced in the first level.

Mechanics
I won’t address any of the other mechanics, since you know, *spoilers*, but all I can say is they all revolve around button mashing your mouse key. Every click shoots one ball of paint, and the developers didn’t add the option to simply hold your key button and unleash a spray of paint. At least, not directly. You can unlock extras in the main menu by finding collectibles (balloons) in the levels. Among those extras: a hose which allows you to hold the button. In my case: I didn’t know you could buy these upgrades so I walked through the entire game mashing my mouse button. Guess you could interpret this critique as my dumb ass being dumb, but I’d like to put it under a weird design choice by the developers.

Story
And now for my last bit of critique: the story. I get that the theme of the game is that of a children’s book and that the story is thus told in such a manner, but this story didn’t have any interesting aspects to it. It’s far too simple and abstract. The only good thing about it is that is comes full circle at the end. It is just there to gently push you forward in the game and that’s all it does. I guess it gets the job done for the 1.5 to 2 hours this game takes to complete.
 
Iswag Newton
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
18.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2022
每个关卡都有一个和视知觉相关的核心机制，我面对开场的一片空白然后随便点了下鼠标左键，之后发生的事简直让我震惊，尽管细想也不是多了不起的想法，但呈现出来的效果太精彩了。

Gaint Sparrow做小而美的体验做的超级好，这一作在视觉上没有《伊迪芬奇》那么精细和多样，但是创意丝毫不差，细节打磨的也很完善，非常值得一玩。

2012년 PS3으로 첫 선을 보였던 1인칭 아티스틱 인디 어드벤처.
고아 소년 먼로가 어머니의 그림에서 사라진 백조를 찾아 떠나는 모험을 그립니다.
잉크를 뿌려 색을 칠하고, 물을 뿌려 식물을 키우는 독특한 진행 방식이 매우 참신하며,

챕터마다 진행 방식이 달라서 약간 아쉬웠고(챕터1 방식으로 끝까지 갔다면..)
볼륨에 비해 정가는 좀 비쌀지도 모르겠습니다.
한국어는 없어서 일본어 버전으로 했는데 더빙도 지원하네요.

NowBobCat
354 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2022
Not Quite a Masterpiece

The Unfinished Swan is Cafe Sparrow's first game. They would later go on to release What Remains of Edith Finch, one of my favorite games of all time, so I was super excited to play this game and see where they started from. The game is good, I don't think there's much denying that, but in my opinion it's nowhere near the masterpiece level that so many people have thrown its way. While the gameplay is unique and it tells a touching story, neither aspect is developed enough to reach the levels of What Remains of Edith Finch, or other similar games. For a first game from a studio with so few people, it's a very unique game worth experiencing.

Story (spoiler free)

The game's story takes place like an old story book as you learn that you are a young orphan who's mother has recently passed away. He's only allowed to take one of her paintings with him and he picks her favorite painting, an unfinished swan. He travels into the painting and this is where the game begins. You learn about a king with the power to create things with his magic paintbrush and travel through his kingdom, learning about his life, and how his kingdom came to be. While it certainly had it's moments (especially in the final chapter) it often times just didn't feel like it was moving along in a meaningful way, or offered very much to the game. This isn't necessarily a bad thing as every game doesn't need a super deep and emotional story, and there were certainly themes that were developed throughout the game but I felt like the developers could've pushed deeper into said themes and it would've created a much more thought provoking experience. I only bring this up because due to the massive number of reviews saying the story brought them to tears, or changed their outlook on life as a whole, I was expecting something on the levels of What Remains of Edith Finch, or Before Your Eyes. Instead it's a story that only scratches the surface of what it could have potentially been.

Gameplay

As you travel through the king's kingdom you must solve puzzles by affecting the environment around you. Each chapter has a different unique mechanic. These help to keep the gameplay varied but unfortunately everything moves so slowly. Your walking pace is pretty slow and there's no sprint option. The worst offender of the slowness are the puzzles dealing with the vines. These vines must be splashed with water in order to grow them so you can reach new areas. Often times the area you need to reach will be quite far away and you'll have to spend a few minutes just sitting there throwing water at these vines in order to get them to grow. There's no worse feeling in a game then knowing exactly what needs to be done abut being forced to sit and do nothing. Simply making the areas smaller, or making the vines grow faster would've easily fixed this but ultimately it's not a major issue. The puzzles are never challenging. Many of them require 0 thinking and this isn't a bad thing, just don't come in expecting a challenging game. The Unfinished Swan is much more focused on the story and overall experience than difficult puzzles. Throughout the game there's balloons that are hidden. If you find enough of them you can buy "toys" that give you new abilities more or less such as a rapid fire option, which is MUCH needed since you will be clicking the mouse button to automatically fire every single ball, which you're doing essentially nonstop. This should've been a default feature as within 10 minutes of starting the game my finger was getting sore.

Conclusion

The Unfinished Swan is a game worth experiencing if you're into shorter story focused experiences. It's definitely not a "walking simulator" as it has quite a lot of interactivity with the environment. It never gets crazy in depth with any aspect of the game, but they're all developed enough to create a pleasant game with a couple memorable moments in it. While $15 may be a bit too much for it, if you can get it on sale and are interested in, it's worth a play through. For more reviews follow my curator page.
 
Eggroll
2,977 produits enregistrés
0

Extremely sweet and short game. This is the sort of game in which you may want to put down that drink of yours and be invested in the story.

Note: for laptop users, grab a mouse. A lot of clicking will occur for the best experience.

The balloon hunt, while optional, does slightly distract you of the story. So, deal with the story first and don't worry about them. There will be a few *invisible* ones that will require you to use a fine comb for searching.

2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 décembre 2021
A fun little game, lasts about 1-2 hours. Mostly a platformer but with a twist; the world around you isnt colored properly, and you have to shoot paint or water to either see whats around you, or help you navigate the world. The story is a short childrens book essentially, nothing too interesting, but enough to move you along. Its the gameplay and concept that are worth seeing. Collect and find balloons while you explore the unique world as a small child in search of answers. Pretty cool artistically but not much more than that.

🍤 🍤🍤🍤🍤🍤🧀 🧀 🧀 🧀

ShrimpyCheese
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 décembre 2022
This one is hard to fully recommend, although the experience was neat and original so I'm giving it a pass. The negative on it was that there was a LOT of clicking especially early on that got really tedious and I often just wished the levels would be over soon, which is not a fun experience. I also didn't really care about the story much and had a hard time paying attention to it for some reason, even though it's right in your face. Kind of a weird one for me, but in the end I felt like I'm glad I played it for it's originality, hence the recommendation.

------------------------------
Control Scheme I Used:
Keyboard and Mouse default bindings. I would have stopped playing with controller likely very fast.

------------------------------
Worth the current price (CDN$ 17.49)? Maybe, it's cheap, but it's also short and slightly boring at times.
What I actually paid: $5.77

------------------------------
Completionist Review:
DLC Achievements: No DLC.
Rating: Pretty quick actually, even the collectables.
Can be completed in one run: You will have to replay a chapter or two because of unlocks.
Chapter Select: There is chapter select, and it DOES say which chapters are missing one collectable, but not another, however the other one is pretty hard to miss so it shouldn't be a problem.
Did I need/use a guide? No, there is actually an unlockable feature for completionists built into the game for the collectables once you've beaten it, which is nice.

Worth completing the game after it's beaten for sure, probably took less than an hour to clean things up once I was done. The built in unlockables are nice for completionists as mentioned earlier too. If you get through the game, and it's fairly short, the rest is pretty quick to do.

Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 septembre 2020
ゲームの内容としては非常に面白かったし是非ともプレイして頂きたい…！
のだけれども、幾つか注意して頂きたい部分があるのでその部分に絞ってレビューします。

まず第一に序盤のエリア、普段3D酔いを起こさない私でさえ具合悪くなりました
。遠近感が掴みづらい配色と、プレイの都合上視点をぐるぐる動かさなければならないので、めちゃくちゃ酔います。
個人差はあるとは思いますが3D酔いやてんかんを起こしやすい方は気をつけて下さい。

もうひとつ。翻訳が丁寧過ぎる所為か、字幕と音声がズレまくってます。
音声の途中で字幕が消えるので、ゆったり読んでいると追いつけなくなります。
音声が途切れる事はないので問題無いですが、その所為で色々と残念な部分があります。
特に
エンディング中、最後の大事なお話が、「～～～（めっちゃ大急ぎで語る）なのでしたはいおしまい！」みたいな感じなのがそこまでの雰囲気を台無しにしているのが
ものすごく残念でした。

何れにせよ上記2点だけ気をつけて頂ければ良いゲームだと思いますので、ゆっくりとプレイされることをお勧めします。

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2020
A fun, unique take on the "throw paint" puzzle game genre.

Pros:
* Level design keeps it fresh, adding new mechanics in each level.
* Pleasant music.
* Unlockable "toys" (upgrades).

♥♥♥♥:
* I hate, hate, hate spiders when I'm blindly wandering in the dark. They're both combined, albeit briefly, in one level.
* Collectibles that are literally impossible to get all of, in a single one playthrough - requires an unlockable-after-endgame upgrade to get them all. (White balloon in an all-white level? Black balloon, high up, in an all-black level? Really?)

Meh:
* No instructions - I almost gave up the 1st time I played, until I clicked my mouse. Admittedly, not a huge deal, but I found it a little annoying.
* Unoriginal plot.

TL;DR: 7/10 - Fun experience, but it'll take at least two playthroughs to get all collectibles.
 
tran_fors
4
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2022
This game is what a prototype looks like before you actually make a game. I finished it. I enjoyed a few moments where it presented something new or cool. The rest of the time I was just killing time. And I usually like games like this.

The game's main--which is basically its only--mechanic isn't polished. It doesn't feel good. It has bugs. It has glitchy results. It's just not acceptable when that's the only thing the game has going for it.

I would have liked and wanted to go hunting cleverly-hidden collectibles or something. But like... meh. Graphics are just annoying at some point after the novelty wears off. And your "painting" doesn't really do much to actually.... well, paint.

One thing I will say is that the ending did some brilliant stuff I didn't expect at all. I guess because the rest of the game set such low expectations. Unfortunately, this is was way too late.

I feel like the game had a brilliant idea but barely made it past first playable demo before everyone decided it was goon enough and just an arty indie thing so it's okay if it's unfinished.

Steam forums don't have a single developer reply, even to technical issues. So what can I conclude about this other than it's basically dumped on Steam for extra income during discount season. I guess this pushed my review to not recommended.

Play Scanner Sombre instead. Or wait for a extra-large discount, I guess.
 
sober
1,035 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 septembre 2020
미완성 그림에서 튀어나온 백조를 쫓아 동화같은 왕국을 탐험하는 이야기

개인적으로 평가하기 꽤 애매한 게임 중 하나인데, 어중간한 눈호강, 어중간한 스토리, 그리고 어중간한 재미를 지닌 게임이라 망작은 아닌데 그렇다고 대작이라고 평가하기에는 아쉬운 게임이었기 때문이다. 왜 모든 게 어중간하다고 느꼈는지 (그리고 왜 비추천을 했는지) 서술을 해보자면,

1. 게임의 구성

게임 진행방식은 대부분 페인트 공을 던지면서 벽면에 색을 칠하거나 (1챕터) , 덩굴을 자라게 한다거나 (2챕터) , 아니면 물체를 건드려서 움직이고 벽을 만든다던가 (3챕터) 하는 방식으로 "퍼즐" 들을 푸는 방식이다. 말이 퍼즐이지, 사실 게임 태그 내 퍼즐 플랫폼 게임이라는 태그가 무색할 정도로 "뭔가 워킹 시뮬레이터만 만들면 평생 게임 내 길만 걷다가 지루할까 봐 퍼즐향을 약간 첨가한 수준" 이다. 믈론 워킹 시뮬레이터에 퍼즐을 약간 넣은 게임 구성이 별로라는 건 아닌데, 문제는 이 퍼즐들이 참 지루하고 노가다성이 어느 정도 있다는 점이다. 특히 2챕터의 게임 진행방식은 이동하고자 하는 방향으로 페인트 공을 계속 던지면서 덩쿨이 자라게 하는 걸 기다리는 일과 방향을 조정하는 과정에서 마우스 좌클릭을 계속 연타하는 일이 별로 즐겁지는 않았다. 그나마 3챕터 후반부에서 페인트 공을 이용해 벽을 만드는 게 재미가 있었는데, 이 정도까지 와야 게임에 재미를 느낄 정도면..... 솔직히 게임의 초반부에 게임의 재미를 이끌어내야지 여기까지 와야 그나마 재미를 느낄 정도면 조금 애매하지 않나? 라는 생각이 들었다. 게다가 게임이 진행될수록 초반에 느꼈던 "페인트공을 이용해 세상을 색칠해나간다는 컨셉" 이 점점 느껴지지 않으면서, 페인트라는 소재를 게임 내 너무 얕게 사용한다는 느낌을 받았다.

2. 게임의 비주얼

8년 전에 나온 게임을 비주얼로 까기에는 양심이 없는 건 아닌가? 라고 생각할 수도 있는데, 사실 비주얼은 딱히 지적할 부분이 없을 정도로 마음에 들었다. 특히 게임 초반부에 나오는 미로나, 챕터 2의 배경이 되는 하얀색 왕국은 정말 괜찮았다. (안타깝게도 게임이 제일 재미가 있었던 마지막 챕터는, 비주얼적으로는 별로 마음에 들지 않았다.) 게임 내 연출도 (페인트 공을 벽면에 던지면 동화책 페이지가 나타나는 연출이나, 아니면 엔딩 장면의 연출) 나쁘지 않았는데, 밑에 3번 이유 때문에 기억에 잘 남지 않았다는 느낌이 들었다.

3. 게임의 스토리

좋게 말하면 동화같은 이야기고, 나쁘게 말하면 뭔가 감동이나 교훈 같은 건 없이 한 귀로 흘려듣는 듯한 이야기이다. 물론 진짜 게임 엔딩을 보고 정신이 나갈 거 같았던 Evan's Remain나 The Suicide of Rachel Foster보다는 선녀이긴 한데, 이런 이야기의 특징은 "게임이 마음에 들었다면 잔잔한 여운이 남는 스토리, 그러나 마음에 들지 않았다면 "내가 이런 결말을 보기 위해 이 게임의 엔딩까지 달려왔나?" 라고 허무감을 느끼게 하는 스토리" 가 되어 누가 평가하느냐에 따라 긍정적인 요소 혹은 부정적인 요소가 될 수 있다는 점이다. 특히, 이런 워킹 시뮬레이터는 퍼즐이나 액션이 중점이 되는 게임이 아니라, 자연스럽게 게임이 얼마나 아름답고, 얼마나 괜찮은 스토리를 품고 있느냐? 에 따라 평가가 갈리기 때문에, 이렇게 개인적으로 애매한 스토리를 지닌 워킹 시뮬레이터류 게임을 평가하게 되면 추천을 하기 망설여진다.

4. 왜인지 모르겠는데 게임을 하면서 느끼게 되는 심한 멀미

1인칭 시점 게임은 잘 안할 정도로, 좁은 시점에 흔들림이 심한 게임을 하게 되면 두통이 심해지는데 이 게임은 그래픽도 단순한 와중에 멀미를 정말 심하게 느꼈다. 특히, 2챕터에서 덩굴을 타야하는 구간은 벽에 머리를 계속 박으면서 가야 하기 때문에, 이 챕터 중반까지 와서 머리가 너무 아파서 중단하고 다음 날 이어서 게임을 해야 했다. 혹시 나처럼 1인칭 시점에서 멀미를 잘 느끼는 사람이라면 꼭 주의를 하길 바란다.


결론적으로, 시각적으로 보기에는 나쁘지 않은 게임인데, 굳이 이런 게임성과 재미를 지닌 게임을 이 가격에 사라고 하는 건 비추천한다. 플레이타임도 약 3시간 밖에 안 될 정도로 그리 긴 게임은 아니기 때문에, 해보고 싶다면 세일을 할 때 사서 해보는 걸 권장한다.

여담) 챕터 2부터 게임을 하다 보면 뜬금없이 캐릭터의 시점이 180도 돌아가는 이상한 버그가 종종 발생했는데, 이게 위에서 말한 멀미를 유발하는 원인 중 하나였던 것 같다.
 
Nixmachine

HennyAndLean
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 janvier 2022
我太爱这个游戏了，独特的玩法和富含意境的氛围，这种风格简直是我梦中情游
不废话，它就是一个艺术品。

完成第一章后的感想总结成一句话：
在交错的平面上染色，一步步前进。等你停下步伐休息时，回头一看，那个由纯黑和纯白构建出来的立体景色会震惊刚刚从中走出来的你。
玩法很简单，可以理解为丢墨滴染色，通过不同色块的拼接交错，在大脑中构建出空间中每个物体的位置。

通关后补充：前期玩法偏 染色 探索，后期偏 解密 探索。剧情不算复杂，但是仍旧非常有意思，景色也相当不错，随便截一张都是壁纸。

如果宣传图的风格很吸引你的话，那就别看什么评论了，快买！血赚不亏！

晕3D和空间感不强的玩家谨慎尝试，刚开始没有阴影的章节会很折磨人。 （生理意义上的，45分钟完成chapter1后我感觉有点轻微的眼花和头晕） 但主要就 第一和第二章前半段 会如此，慢慢摸索通过后，剩下的章节就更偏向 解密 和 剧情 了

I just finished the game and there are some toys to use which are to buy with collectibles but I don't really care about them because you can use some of them in your next playthroughs and some of them are usable in your first playthrough but they doesn't really matter. 1,461 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 mai 2021
There are 2 main reasons for why I can not recommend this game. First some background.

I really enjoyed what remains of edith finch and got this game since it was made by the same team, if you expect a similar experience you will be disappointed. I took my time in this game and i still finished it in under 90 minutes, even so some core mechanics of the game managed to become tedious in that short time.

This game is a gimmick with a story that relies heavily on a few core mechanics, but, given only this I would still recommend it on sale, now for the real travesties which resulted in my negative overall impression.

1. The game does not support 3440x1440 resolution, but only 2560x1080... why? It would be so easy to include this option if you would have gone through the effort of porting it properly.

2. The game sometimes had occasional framedrops, which is not an issue in itself, might be due to my hardware, the real issue is that the mouse sensitivity is in some way bound to the FPS. This means that a lower FPS will increase your sensitivity?? Was this tested at all before you released the port?? This makes the game sporadically unplayable and much less enjoyable.

These two quite egregious technical issues makes this game a huge no go for me, mainly because it indicates deep disrespect for the players. I am very disappointed overall.
 
Sgt.Squirrel

462 produits enregistrés

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2023
这是一个集故事、解密、收集为一体的游戏。虽然不支持中文，但是用英文最多的主要是剧情故事的内容，如果你比较好奇剧情的话，去截图翻译一下就可以知道这个故事讲述：一个小男孩跟随着天鹅的脚步，误入了喜欢创意绘画的国王所管辖的领域，然后展开的一系列奇妙的体验冒险。
玩法：wsad-控制行进；space空格-跳跃；鼠标左键-投掷探索道具；F-工具互动。
第一场景：池塘。探索道具：墨水弹（主要作用：探路，或探索物体形状，打击🎈）。
第二场景：花园。探索道具：墨水弹。
第三场景：外小镇。探索道具：墨水弹（主要作用：除之前的作用外，还可以打击机关，使其运作起来）。
第四场景：迷宫。探索道具：墨水弹。【这里不一定要进入迷宫深处，有时候只是为了收集🎈。】
第五场景：内城堡。探索道具：水弹。辅助道具：花藤（主要作用：探路、打击机关、促生长；特殊使用方法：用水弹对准花藤或周围，想往哪个方向生长就朝花藤周围扔水弹，以此达到茂盛甚至可以攀爬的程度）。【不能掉入深水中，否则会被淹死】
第六场景：黑夜。探索道具：墨水弹。辅助道具：光源。【这里尽量要在亮处行动，不能长时间行走于黑暗中，不然会被蜘蛛虫子伤害而死】
第七场景：黑夜中的异次空间。探索道具：墨水弹。（特殊作用：绘制点、面、体搭建成3D踏板）
—End—
 
0u0嗯哼哼

Évaluation publiée le 18 mai 2021
世界観とパズル、インク投げによって建築物を把握させる構造はとても楽しかった。私はコントローラーでプレイしたが酔いはせず、全体としては楽しく遊べた。全体なら間違いなく高評価なんだけど、チャプター３の森と川だけは嫌だった。特に最初の森。暗くて、ライト代りの玉から少し離れると見えない敵に攻撃される。そしてその玉が止まらない場所に収集物の風船があること。風船のあるところに玉を誘導しようとしても全然出来なくて詰みました。あとその一つなのに…。このゲームにそういうイライラアクションは求めてなかった。風船コンプしないと買えないアイテムとか遊べないものがあるので、なんか損した気分。それ以外は楽しかった。
 
-翠-
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2023
Экспериментальный проект без особых откровений в геймплее и сторителлинге, но любителям Annapurna Interactive однозначно зайдёт. Игра умеет приятно удивлять своей эстетикой, первая глава имеет самобытный геймплей и сама история по сути милая сказка о преемственности поколений.

Геймплейно это симулятор ходьбы с минимальным влиянием на окружающий мир, ведь все что мы можем это прыгать и кидать цветные шарики окрашивая интерьер вокруг. Каждая из четырех глав старается удивить тебя игровым новшеством и в целом к концу игры заскучать ты не успеешь. Идея где все игровое пространство белое и необходимо бросать шарики с краской что бы его осветить и понять куда и как идти - просто восхитительна, как визуально так и геймплейно. Пройдя определенную дистанцию приятно даже обернуться и посмотреть на уродливо испачканное пространство, которое раньше для нашего восприятия просто не существовало. При этом, это не тупое закрашивание, ведь важно что бы черное и белое контрастно взаимодействовали, только так окружающие объекты обретут зримый объём. В последующих уровнях эта идея не исчезнет, но уйдёт на второй план при появлении других игровых механик. Головоломки интуитивно понятны и вся игра больше напоминает потоковое путешествие по нарисованному миру. Минималистическая стилистика, приятная локализация и межстрочный юмор создали для меня отличные условия для неспешного и расслабляющего геймплея.
 
dimmoh1
506 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2022
5 Jahre vor der Veröffentlichung von What Remains of Edith Finch haben die Entwickler dieses Werk für die PlayStation geschaffen. Es ist ein Spiel mit Mechaniken, die sehr simpel sind und für einige unbekannt sein dürften.

Das Spiel zeichnet sich durch seinen eigenen Stil aus und dauert keine 4 Stunden. Im Vergleich zum "Nachfolger" behandelt The Unfinished Swan keine ernsthaften Themen. Es ist ein schönes, kleines Erlebnis für jede Altersklasse.

Izolt
910 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2021
単純に「このアイデア凄ぇなぁ」と感心。
高度なCG処理とは全く別方向な「3DCGならでは」なプレイ体験が斬新で新鮮で楽しかった。
チャプターごとに微妙にゲーム性が違っているのも良いです。(面倒臭ぇ！と思わされる所もあるが…)

パズル的な難度はあまり高くはなく、導線も分かりやすいと思う。
水に落ちたり敵？に襲われると死亡？するが、その場/直前で即時リスタートで実質ゲームオーバーはない。
収集物は即時セーブされるので周回などもやりやすい。総じて親切設計。

インディー系ながらしっかり吹替まであるのも素晴らしい。
(エンディングで字幕とズレしまっていて、未だ修正されないままなのは難点だが…。PS版も同様なのかな？)

散見される「酔い」について
自分は3D酔いしないタイプですが、それでもチャプター1は若干クラクラしました。(プレイ不可なほどではなかった)
たぶん、いわゆる3D酔いとは異なる類の、「グレゴリーのダルメシアン犬」みたいな錯視を延々見続けてるようなものか。そりゃあ脳ミソキツいだろうなぁと。
(同じ類かは分からないけど)ステレオグラムだとかが苦手な人には辛いのかもしれない。
 
FBI
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2020
C'est un jeu très poétique et très très calme.
Je pense malheureusement que je ne sois pas vraiment le public cible... C'est typiquement le genre de jeu qui est parfaitement adapté pour des enfants et que j'aurai aimé découvrir au temps ou on me lisais des histoires car c'est vraiment ca qu'est ce jeu: un compte pour enfant.
Pour enfant mais pas dénué de sens et d'intérêt.
Personnellement je vais me faire rembourser mais sûrement le racheter si il passe en promo à 4~5€


PS: Si vous hésiter à l'acheter et que vous avez des questions vous pouvez m'envoyer un message (j'ai seulement 0,5h de jeu mais je me suis intéressé à des articles/vidéos pour voir si le jeu allait prendre une autre direction par la suite)

Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2021
I've also played this on PS3, PS Vita and PS4. It was great to revisit this gem. It has a lot of neat ideas, the overall use of them remains relatively simple. But I don't think it needs to be overly complex with puzzles to be fun. I'd say it's an "artsy" type game, but the gameplay is more traditionally structured than most of what you'd expect from that label. But it's different.

The game starts with you in pitch white, with only black paintballs to find your way through (with a sparse gold to give you direction and unchanging land markers). Then you move to a shaded area where it's easier to navigate, but the black is still required. Then eventually you start to grow vines to climb around and to help see with blue/water balls which temporarily outline the enviornments that offer no visability on their own. And then into the darkness where light is your guide and the surprisingly intuitive and neat 'building' sections.

Despite having played through the game multiple times always forget just how much variety is in the experience. They packed a lot of ideas into the game with such simple mechanics. It's quite neat what they accomplished.

The art design is awesome, the book illustrates are adorable and the voice acting/narration brings it all together to fit the storybook aesthetic/theme perfectly. It all just works as such a complete package.

The PC version changed up the main menu look which is interesting. Each option is more of a 'picture' in a frame rather than just a list like it was before. And the "toys" (upgrades basically) are shown in the book rather than a list. Not sure why those things were changed, but it's something I noticed looking at a balloon guide (can't seem to remember where they all are despite having done all the trophies three times)

If you like different types of games, kind of in the vein of Journey, Flower, Abzu, and the like then you owe it to yourself to play this. It's right up there in quality. It just has a more structured design with a more straight forward narrative.
 
Elvick
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2023
第一章被玩法给惊讶到了，墨水染出来的图像也很好看。第一章过了之后开始感到无聊，我想后面还有四章都是这样白色的空间泼墨水岂不是要累死啊。然而这游戏狠狠打了我的脸，巨型迷宫、滴水生蔓、三维成型，每一个创意都带来了及其不同且趣味非凡的体验，城堡等建筑景观更是可以用壮观来形容。同时色彩也随着章节的推进不断丰富，真的很喜欢这种简约而精美的卡通风。耐着性子玩下去，你会被创意和剧情吸引的。希望支持简体中文，逐字翻译真的很累。另外，我认为这款游戏很适合正在培养想象力与创造力的儿童，正如游戏开始界面一般，像是一个不错的绘本。

Recommandé
6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 septembre 2020
As this kind of game becomes more common, the tendency is to grade them down. But even though Swan uses its best trick in the first level, I still enjoyed it enough to play though the main story. The art is bland, but evocative. The play is simple, but not -completely- devoid of challenge. The five hours I've clocked are just for the balloon challenge, which is trash because of a few unintuitive placements. (Shoutout to head of playtesting: I have your name, and your likeness, and for allowing that one up the dark hill into the final build, you are going in the Death Note). There's enough interesting here to kill an hour or two for the $5.00 I paid, and the surprise voice actor they got for the King brought a smile. But unless you REALLY like to contemplate games as an artform (the map design is absolutely the best I've ever seen in this genre!), there's not much here. ★☆☆
 
Zexyz
573 produits enregistrés

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mars 2021
Wenn Giant Sparrow, die Entwickler des epischen und wunderschönen What remains of Edith Finch, ein neues Spiel rausbringen, bin ich natürlich dabei. Und hier ist es: The Unfinished Swan.

Worum geht es eigentlich? Wir sind ein kleiner Junge, dessen Mutter gestorben ist. Sie war Malerin und unser Lieblingsbild von ihr ist das eines Schwanes, der nicht ganz vollendet ist - genau wie jedes einzelne ihrer Bilder. Eines Nachts jedoch ist das Bild leer. Wir folgen dem Schwan durch die Leinwand und beginnen damit eine Reise in eine zunächst komplett weiße Welt.

Mehr werde ich inhaltlich nicht verraten, aber es sei erwähnt, dass dies - trotz großartiger Synchronsprecher und sehr stimmiger Musik - nicht jedermanns Spiel sein dürfte. Wer sich allerdings darauf einlassen kann, mit einer Farbkanone Kleckse zu verschießen und so langsam immer mehr von der Welt und ihrer Geschichte zu entdecken, wird auf jeden Fall seinen Spaß daran haben und die irgendwie verträumt-märchenhafte Stimmung genießen können.

Meiner Meinung nach ein wirklich schönes Spiel!
 
Wingah_Dingah

3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2020
Fiz um vídeo com a análise completa e com a minha interpretação da história, as reflexões que tive após jogar esse belíssimo jogo, então passa lá pra gente trocar uma ideia a respeito dele!

Vidéo YouTube™: Esse Jogo INDIE de 10 ANOS Atrás é INCRÍVEL! | The Unfinished Swan - Vale a Pena Jogar? 
Vues : 55
Nesse vídeo faço uma análise completa (se vale ou não a pena jogar) do jogo indie The Unfinished Swan (em português - O Cisne Inacabado), um game muito interessante de aventura e puzzle, com uma...


Vidéo YouTube™: Por Que Você DESISTE dos Seus SONHOS? - Uma Reflexão sobre The Unfinished Swan 
Vues : 26
The Unfinished Swan é um dos melhores exemplos de que jogos podem sim ser obras de arte. Essa inclusive é uma das bandeiras que defendo aqui no canal, jogos são obras de arte (uns mais outros menos).


Deixo aqui uma análise dos elementos do jogo!

O Cisne Inacabado é um jogo de aventura e puzzle onde você explora um reino escondido e misterioso jogando tinta para revelar o mundo que está à sua volta. Basicamente é como se tudo fosse um grande quadro em branco que ao entrar em contato com sua tinta revela todo o mundo do jogo.

HISTÓRIA - basicamente se trata de seguir o cisne que ‘fugiu’ da obra inacabada e explorar aquele novo mundo desconhecido e é uma espécie de conto de fadas infantil, e ela é contada exatamente dessa forma, com algumas páginas do livro que você revela durante as fases e animações ao final delas. Todas essas páginas e animações curtas são narradas, e o jogo tem tradução em um monte de língua, inclusive em português.

Apesar da história ter começo, meio e fim, ela pode, assim como uma obra de arte num quadro, despertar diferentes sentimentos, sensações e memórias dependendo da sua história de vida, e claro, da sua interpretação da história.

SONS / TRILHA SONORA - Os sons e trilha sonora são excelentes, a música passa as emoções certas para cada momento, seja nos momentos calmos ou nos mais intensos e de modo geral a música conversa muito bem com a história.

JOGABILIDADE / PUZZLES - é muito simples você dispara bolas de tinta, anda e pula. Quanto aos puzzles, de modo geral são fáceis, mas achei bem equilibrados, são bem tranquilos de resolver mas não são aqueles puzzles imbecis de muito fácil, nem os puzzles impossíveis sem sentido. E a progressão da complexidade dos puzzles e as formas de interagir com os cenários são muito boas também. Existem alguns balões meio escondidos durante as fases que servem como espécie de colecionáveis e como moeda para liberar alguns extras no menu do jogo.

GRÁFICOS - apesar de simples, é muito bom. Achei um estilo artístico muito legal, bem na pegada conto de fadas infantil mesmo, e a distribuição de cores é muito boa, apesar da predominância do preto e branco. Enfim, o jogo em muitos momentos parece um grande quadro branco e com sua tinta você vai criando um caminho e revelando uma arte.

RESUMO - Se o jogo vale a pena ou não, na minha opinião vale se você quer ter uma experiência diferente, dado essa mecânica do jogo de revelar o ambiente por meio da tinta, e se você gosta de jogos com histórias que te fazem refletir.

Importante ressaltar que o jogo é bem curto, levei cerca de 2h, 2h30, para finalizar. Na minha opinião acho que vale o preço cheio, mas como é curto talvez valha a pena esperar uma promoção.
 
MAGOverso
0

283 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2023
先说一下整款游戏的特点以及需要注意部分。首先这款游戏接近步行模拟，虽说有一些有趣的解谜，但整体的游戏性还是不太足够，他的游戏性略高于该工作室的后一部作品What Remains in Edith Finch。同时游戏为了表达，会出现你在一个纯白的迷宫里找路的情况，这种没有视觉锚点的3D游戏会造成极大的晕动，如果晕3D的话你连这款游戏的实况视频都看不了。本游戏的晕仅仅小于The Witness和The Talo's Principle。最后一点，这款游戏没有中文，虽然文字量其实不算大，但是这款游戏的内容基本都由文字表达。

游戏的玩法相当新奇，几乎整个游戏流程中画面都是残缺的，而玩家操作的核心都是扔球。但是随着游戏的推进，球的功能也在发生改变：最开始是投出墨汁来标记墙面地面，从而更好地找路；然后是投出水球来浇灌藤蔓指引其生长，从而去到各种本不能去的位置；之后是投出球来指引生成地块的大小与高度，从而完成原地图中不存在的路。这些是我们探索的必要部分，也是这个故事中“国王”所深恶痛绝的，毁灭了其创造的混账行为。这款游戏的玩法还是很多样的，而且玩法展开的很自然，十分符合故事本身，是出于游戏角色角度出发的玩法。我认为这也是Giant Sparrow游戏的一个重要特点，玩法不一定有多高明，但一定很符合角色当时的情况，能让人代入到故事中。

-----------------以下部分剧透。
从背景故事中我们可以得知，前三章中的城堡起初都是有人居住的，这些人也干了和玩家相同的事情，从而激怒了国王，国王本身满怀热情地创作，却得到了不好的反响和擅自的毁坏，国王于是放弃了这些地方。这些地方的人们也搬走了，所以等我们的主角门罗来到的时候，城市荒无人烟。
主角/玩家实际上是身临其境地在这个城市生活，我们惊叹于这个城市的巧思之外，也能理解居民们的不满，这些城市好看归好看，但是实在是太不实用了，人们在里面分不清方向，外来的东西也进不到这座城市里来。这是这个故事的第一部分，介绍了国王，他极度追求美，追求艺术创作，但是他从未完成任何作品；他狂傲，认为任何颜色都不够资格填入他的城堡，于是他保留了一片纯白；他作为国王，但心中却没有任何人民，只专注于自己的创作，只有在民众威胁到自己的创作时才会做出让步。

接下来就是这个故事的第二部分，国王厌倦了创作完美的王国却只会招来一群不懂欣赏的人的生活，于是他在一个阴森可怕的地方创造了自己的家，并且他找到了一个另外的课题：他想要把自己的伟大创造传承下去。方法也很传统：组建一个家庭。他没怎么和异性交往过，于是他选择了一个更简单粗暴的方法，自己画一个心仪的女人出来，不出人意料的，他画出了一个女版的自己。国王每天都在想给自己的王后什么礼物，但是王后只要了那支银画笔，并且非常有趣的是，王后也从未完成自己的任何一幅画作。国王每天都在致力于将王后的姿色画出来，但是每幅画他都觉得不满意。但是在王后临产前一天，她离开了，只带走了自己的一幅未完成的天鹅。

接下来就是故事的最后一部分，王后离开后，国王九年的时间没有再画画，在生命的最后，他想要建造一尊自己的雕像，却连草图都画不完；他睡了过去，却在自己的梦中困住。直到门罗到达他所在的阁楼，他才终于醒过来，我们才知道原来国王在梦中跟在我们的后面，看完了自己被毁坏的所有城堡，所有建筑。他原以为虽然自己没有完成这些城堡，但这些城堡将被记住，将会作为自己生命的延续永远存在，但是他不得不接受一个令人心痛的事实：短短十年，这些城堡就已凋敝，这些东西将会先于他而死亡，并且他的死亡也已迫近。
他参加了自己的葬礼，但葬礼空无一人，只有自己的儿子，也就是我们的主角门罗出席。他为了自己心中的艺术付出了一生，忽视了人民，忽视了家庭，连自己的儿子都只见过一面，最终他作为一名国王，死了都无人知晓。但他却并不后悔，他在生命的最后俯瞰自己的所有未完成的杰作，突然想通了一个道理，宇宙总有一天会灭亡，而那一天所有的东西也会消失殆尽；他的作品也总有一天会消失，会被后人的作品所覆盖，就像他在前人的作品上创作一样。他回望这一切，才发现他从未对自己未完成的作品有愧疚，也未曾对它们即将的消失而难过，相反地，创作它们的过程令他乐此不疲。哪怕他的生命重来千万次，他也还会这么做。
在生命的最后，他将画笔传给了自己的儿子：
“这只画笔已不属于我，我已完成了我的作品，现在它是你的了。希望他能给你带来快乐，也希望有一天人们会说，他比他的父亲更伟大。”

这个故事可以有很多种解读，其中的核心矛盾就是“美与实用”与“未完成”。
艺术本身无论再怎么完美，也无法避免后人参与到其中，唯一让艺术保持原状的方法，就是与世隔绝，但与世隔绝的艺术却又没有了存在的意义，其与一抔尘土无异。国王想尽一切办法让人们不再干扰他的作品，但这也让他的作品失去了生机，国王也在这个过程中被消磨完了热情，只留下了一堆未完成的作品。
国王最初希望自己的作品能够流芳百世，希望自己的形象能永垂千古，于是他塑造了这些城堡与塑像，但他却发现，这些东西甚至活不过自己。但他最后还是确认了自己的想法：哪怕没有这些尘俗的东西，这创作的过程也让他快乐。这样解读就更像What Remains in Edith Finch的“不为心生则弗如死”的主题。
而对于结尾，我的解读是，国王清楚自己的所作所为，他知道自己是一个不负责任的父亲，知道自己在人们心中是一个罔顾百姓的国王，甚至说自己的儿子早年成为了孤儿，举目无亲，算是一个“未完成的作品”。他追随自己心中的艺术，一生从未后悔，但是在生命的最后一刻，他希望自己的儿子不要走自己的路。
而在故事的最后一刻，门罗完成了自己的第一幅画作，是那只未被完成的鹅。对绘画的热爱成功地传承了下去。

顺便说一下，国王在追随自己的艺术的过程中，也变得越来越离群索居，最终失去一切，怎么感觉这才是更具有现实意义的解释......

哦对了，国王的配音是一名导演，Terry Gilliam。获得过BAFTA终身成就奖，听说作品也是离经叛道。
 
Madivh

Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2021
Petite déception pour ce jeu, déjà impossible de re mapper les touches, faut donc passer le clavier en QWERTY, bon il y a déjà beaucoup de review qui le mentionne mais faut le rappeler.

Le principe me plaisait mais les contrôle sont trop aléatoires, la sensibilité de la souris/caméra est un coup ridiculement faible et un coup tu fais un 360°, ça devient vite pénible, rajouté à ça le déplacement du personnage, alors oui c'est un enfant et pas un super héros, mais il se déplace à 2 à l'heure avec l'inertie d'un paquebot...

Ces désagréments rendent l'expérience de jeu trop désagréable à mon goût et ce malgré un gameplay sympa et une esthétique belle.
Dommage j'aurais voulu y faire jouer mes enfants pour le coté ludique et la narration...

Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

The Unfisnished Swan é maravilhoso, a mecânica dele da tinta me emociona e ainda está pendente na minha lista para pegar zerar e platinar, jogando Edith Finch nesse carnaval percebi que a ligação que ele tem com "Swan" é através do irmão da escritora do livro sobre a família "é o quarto que é uma torre separada aonde ele sumiu entrando em uma porta de tinta" no quarto dele tem a imagem de um quadro de bambus que tem no jogo "Swan", quando vi aquilo meus olhos brilharam. O jogo vale a pena, compra em promo, traz a mesma satisfação que é jogar Edith Finch só que em outra linguagem, e se você estuda teoria das cores e artes (composição, perspectiva e etc) você se encanta com os mínimos detalhes colocados ali em termos técnicos, caso não tenha muito conhecimento nesse quesito, relaxa, você não vai perder nada, o jogo é feito com amor e bastante tinta então toca até a pessoa mais simples.

10.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2023
Very cool concept for a cute story, pretty graphics, good mechanics ideas, but poor execution.

This feels like an early access, as the game feels somewhat unfinished itself.
Found myself being frustrated half the time because of it.
Some parts were even a little infuriating... (Vines climbing is wonky, having to spam water got boring extremely quickly. And that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ball you gotta roll up... Don't get me started.)

But I kept playing because the story was still interesting enough for me to go on.
Despite its unpolished aspect, the experience was nice and I would still recommend, although maybe not at full price.

PS: If you're a dev and you wanna make a blind level achievement.... Don't.

Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 janvier 2021
一场美丽而又奇妙的超现实童话之旅

The Unfinished Swan 未完成的天鹅是开发了艾迪芬奇的记忆的制作组的又一款休闲解谜游戏。

【简评：为太长不看的玩家而准备，评分以优良中差辅以加减，满分为完美】

--画面：优。 游戏画面清新脱俗且颇具创意，一下子就把玩家拉进了一个超现实童话世界里。

--声音：优。 音效自然，音乐和场景很契合。

--剧情：优。 童话般的剧情简单而富有寓意。不过游戏流程很短（2.5小时左右），且没有中文。

--可玩性：优。 本作玩法实际是个需要自己铺路的步行模拟器，解谜的成分非常少，主要是在找路和铺路上面。不过游戏内的收藏品（气球）较多，通关后还能购买各种道具，会让新游戏流程产生一些变化，所以有一定的重复游玩性。

总结：优（83分）。 本作是一款有着清新富有创意音画的休闲解谜游戏。不过游戏第一章会让玩家处在雪盲症般的全白空间里（后续章节无此问题），这可能会对一些第一人称不适应的玩家感到不适，这些玩家需谨慎购买。除此之外喜欢休闲解谜游戏的玩家强烈推荐购买，并且值得原价入手。
 
ZackLee
1,232 produits enregistrés
0

Évaluation publiée le 21 septembre 2020
This is simply the most beautifully designed game I have ever played. The sense of aesthetic in the carefully crafted levels blends seamlessly with the playful story. The way the puzzles emerge from the environment is simply inspired and the player is elegantly carried through visual, narrative, and mechanic progressions. This is the first game I feel strongly transcends the world of video games and should truly be considered a wonderful work of art.

Évaluation publiée le 27 mai 2022
I like this game but I have many issues with it.
This game was released in 2012 /not for PC) , 8 years later we got the PC port. The problem is that in that time period of 8 years many games did what this one did and did it better. Look, I never owned consoles so my 1st play through was now...not in 2012........2022. This is the same issue as with Journey, these games are outdated, still good games but they show their age. You can't rebind the keys and that is a disgrace, it is a PC game now after all!
I had a good time with this game, there were few wow moments but overall had a good time, didn't rush it and if you like artsy games you will most likely have a good time. It is a story driven game but the story felt kind of weird and UNFINISHED to me.
Overall a good game but it is not worth the full price so i recommend buying it at a high discount.

3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mars 2022
I really wish you could separate Steam reviews between "tech" and "story".

Story and gameplay? This is a fun low-stress art game. Highly recommended. Nice mix of mechanics.

Tech-wise? It's sort of a disaster. Bad at figuring out resolutions if you don't want the one it picks, and it might not pick the right one. (I ended up having to edit the config.xml to get it to go back to 1920x1200 after trying 1920x1080). Doesn't work properly with in-home streaming (keyboard input isn't accepted). Controller aiming is weird. Displays weird bands of garbage above and below during cutscenes when set to a 16:10 resolution. And on and on.

Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2020
Legit game, lots of balloons hidden in unfair spots (just the way I like in game collectables IE a challenge to find), great gameplay ideas here.

The port is decent, late as hell to the PC party though.... The original PS3 release is how old, again? Luckly, I still have my old console plugged in with this game installed so I could actually compare the 2 versions. The port is decent enough.

There are ♥♥♥♥ though:
-Not having the ability to change the keymapping/controls is wack as hell
-Framerate drops in the repeating room level when it never lagged like that on the original PS3 version
-Mouse sensitivity doesn't reach high enough for my tastes
-Mouse feels like it has acceleration turned on by default
-No sprint
-Ran into several visual glitches/game glitches that I didn't run into in the PS3 version.
 
nexfin100-senpai-sama-chan-kun
404 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2022
I don't get what this game wants to be, and it's over too quickly.

Interactive story? Didn't feel more impactful than just reading two pages of text with a few images, and there's too much time between the story bits.
Color splash sandbox? Only the first level uses the mechanic properly, the other levels feel like prototypes for different games.
Walking sim with collectables? Probably the best fit. The environments are fun to go through and the secrets are actually somewhat hidden.

Positives:
- The environments are well designed and the progression through each part is effortless.
- The black/white mechanic is very effective in how it makes you observe and navigate the rooms very conciously and carefully (you can't just spam color everywhere because then everything goes from white to black and you can't see any landmarks again).

Neutral:
- Going through the game again to search for the remaining balloons was fun, but it felt a bit pointless. Same with the toys - it's nice that they are there, but most don't really contribute anything to the experience.

Negatives:
- Sound effects are often unpleasant for an otherwise relaxing game.

Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2023
I would post a neutral review if i could but if i have to choose between yey or nay it's a bit closer to yey!
I've been looking for this game since the very early concepts on the YouTube videos, i believe i still have these videos somewhere on my harddrive downloaded from YouTube.
This game will give you an exclusive gameplay experience.
I like the perfect length of the game, it's just the first time i started to think when is the end and 5 minutes later the end of the game! It was just right the perfect length!!
In the level where the shadows appear you will see how bad your monitor is, when you turn the camera you will see how pixels are not fast enough to change their colors between black, white and gray.
On my 120ghz TN monitor i had kinda OLED ghost effect on pixels when you see a colored trail behind pixels when they haven't enough responce time.
Pretty often i had feeling i am tooooooo slooooow!!! I mean i played with a gamepad and camera movement was too slow, of caurse i could use a mouse to move the camera faster but body speed was also too slow.
I was like in a very slow car leaning back and forward trying to make it faster, with words i wanna RUUUN! Let me RUUUUUN!!! Maybe it's made for performance, maybe not to break the slow pace of narrative but i needed to run.

Overall i would give it 6.5/10
It's not a masterpiece but It would definitely give you a new experience of puzzle games.

P,S. Developers thank you for saving the original concept in the game.

1,123 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2022
好像是艾迪芬奇开发团队的处女作，十分优秀，值得推荐（晕3D的快跑）。
这是一个小巧精致的叙事解密游戏。游戏有着非常独特的机制。
游戏的开始是一个纯白的世界，一切物体都没有加以区别。我可以用我手中黑色的墨水球给物体上色，来区别物品、认识世界。“先有了语言，世界便诞生了”我不发一语，而墨水球就是我的语言。
这种新奇的机制，给了我一种奇妙的错觉：好像这些东西之前并不存在，而是我的泼墨创造了他们。现在好像由未来决定，我成了创造一切的画家。

关于剧情，这是一个关于成长的童话故事，其中穿插着孤独、生命、存在、死亡等话题。
随着剧情的推动，我失去了我的画家身份。世界逐渐有了阴影，有黑夜与恐惧，有绿色和生命。物体轮廓逐渐得以显现，游戏由探索转为了解密。
游戏核心解密非常优秀，和精妙的艺术设计、优美又恰到好处的音乐一起，巧妙地叙说着这个黑白王国的故事。
游戏的叙事节奏相当经典。由舒缓逐渐加快节奏，到结尾时达到高潮。
在最后，游戏带给了我直击心灵的震撼。创造一切的人在我眼前呐喊"I saw my life's work laid out in front of me. Soon it would crumble into dust."
在光影变幻之中，在时间逆流之际，一种孤独与虚无的感觉贯穿了我。
“整个世界似乎只是一场梦。一切实在都变成了一场怪梦，没有梦境的生活也没有做梦的心灵。
我的存在、我的活动是梦，我的心灵是梦。它们通过映像联系，却没在任何东西中得到反映。”

然而最出色的机制却成了最致命的缺陷。
这游戏对美术倒是极友好，对玩家极不友好。游戏初期画面只有纯白和纯黑两种颜色。三维的物体，没有阴影没有明暗变化，不走动甚至无法区分物体的两个面。而一旦走动起来观察物体，就会带来极大的晕眩感。
我从来不晕3D，连见证者都顶住了，这游戏玩半个小时就想吐。建议晕3D的人慎入。
 
xx11nn6
329 produits enregistrés
0

0

Évaluation publiée le 26 mai 2021
Conceito legal, mecânica diferente, puzzles simples, ritmo bom, história fofinha.

PORÉM:
> Se você gosta de puzzles, vai achar esse jogo fácil demais.
> Se você gosta de jogos relaxantes, vai odiar os últimos dois capítulos que te obrigam a correr e são muito escuros.
> Se você gosta de história, vai achar essa simples demais pra fazer o jogo todo valer a pena.
> O primeiro capítulo pode te dar um pouco de náusea. A tela branca incomoda os olhos, e o contraste da tinta preta com a tela branca também.

O jogo é meio pato (ou cisne?), tem vários elementos legais, mas é mediano em todos eles. Vale a pena comprar em promoção.

Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2021
O
nce upon a time, there was a game. A game with a nice tale and charming graphics. The tale was told through short cinematics and beautiful sceneries. Capturing every moments and surprises into a splendid canvas of black and white, with a little touch of color.

T
he controls were simple and enabled the player to focus on what was most important, the unfinished swan. A creature that flew from scene to scene, guiding the player to what he or she was about to discover.

B
eauty was not always prevailing in this surreal game. As time taught us, where there is light, there is also darkness.

I
f this felt intriguing, so will The Unfinished Swan. And I'm done, because it's Sunday and I got something else to do than write a steam review :D

Gioco di una poesia e delicatezza incredibile. Un'opera d'arte, ricca d'emozioni, la storia di un bambino che perde la madre e cerca di ricostruire un rapporto col padre che ha abbandonato la famiglia. La storia gira intorno ad una serie di racconti mostrati tramite dipinti, schizzi d'inchiostro e giochi di luci e fisica. Come al solito ANNAPURNA non sbaglia il colpo!

Majo
702 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 octobre 2020
Co było przed Edith Finch?

Mnogość i różnorodność i jeszcze więcej mechanik w baśniowym świecie...

Rozdział 1.
Do prekursora What Remains of Edith Finch podeszłam bardzo entuzjastycznie, ciesząc się, że będę mogła zagrać w grę na Steam.
Pierwszy rozdział naprawdę mnie zachwycił. W białym świecie złożonym z białych elementów używamy balonów z czarną farbą, aby odsłonić przygotowany dla nas przedsionek królestwa. Chodzenie i rzucanie farbą sprawiało mi niesamowitą frajdę, a ujawnianie fragmentów scenerii zachwyca elegancką prostotą.

Później doszły nowe mechaniki, i jak dla mnie, to pogorszyło sprawę...

Rozdział 2.
W kolejnym rozdziale za pomocą balonów z wodą podlewamy mury, aby wyhodować bluszcz i się po nim wspinać do następnych lokacji. Jako osoba pedantyczna poświęciłam mnóstwo czasu na zwilżanie potężnych krzaków. Jak się okazało, zupełnie niepotrzebnie traciłam czas, bo wspinać się można po zaledwie kilku gałązkach. Gra dalej była piękna i ożywianie scenerii zielenią nie było złe, ale mozolność nawilżania murów trochę pozbawiła mnie przyjemności z grania.

Rozdział 3.
Co robią zabójcze pająki w mojej baśni...? W następnej partii rozgrywki, nie dość, że jest ciemno, to jeszcze można zostać zaatakowanym przez mordercze bestie. Rozgrywka znów przeszła modernizację i tym razem, niczym żuk gnojowy toczymy przed sobą kulkę światła, oczywiście strzelając do niej z balonów, aby oświetlić sobie drogę i uniknąć śmierci z paszczy pajęczaków... A później, gdy już dotrzemy do bezpiecznej przystani, budujemy klocki. Dużo klocków...

Rozdział 4.
Jest króciutki, można przejść go błyskawicznie, gra się niemal ścigając się z czasem. Poziom ma ciekawy klimat. Wyczuwa się destrukcję i degrengoladę świata przedstawionego.

Rozdział 5.
Stanowi podsumowanie wszystkich mechanik przedstawionych w grze.
Informacja, że jeden z bohaterów zawsze widzi creditsy w snach niezmiennie mnie bawi!

The Unfinished Swan debiutowała w 2012 roku na konsole. Wówczas gra zbierała entuzjastyczne recenzje. Moją uwagę zwróciły zachwyty nad brakiem jakichkolwiek tutoriali. Gra nie odrywa gracza od rozgrywki jakimiś samouczkami. Tytuł rzuca gracza na głęboką wodę i albo użytkownik się nauczy, co trzeba zrobić, aby progresować, albo nie. Chyba nie jestem zwolennikiem "tough love" i wolę być trzymana za rękę, by delikatnie się popluskać, dlatego nie rozumiem komplementów pod tym adresem. Momentami byłam bardzo zagubiona w grze. Szczególnie w momencie, kiedy trzeba użyć nowej mechaniki, a ja jeszcze nie wiem, jak ona działa.

The Unfinished Swan zachwyca pod względem estetyki wykonania. W polskiej wersji językowej miła pani pieściła moje uczy prowadząc baśniową narrację. Grafika jest wyjątkowa. Każdy rozdział jest unikatowy i czarujący. Najbardziej podobały mi się pierwsze poziomy, jednak umiem docenić, że wszystkie zostały wykonane z ciekawym pomysłem i troską o szczegóły.

Dawno nie widziałam aż tak wymagających osiągnięć (Minimalista). Lubię przechodzić gry w całości, ale odblokowanie wszystkiego zajęło mi sporo czasu. Być może było to spowodowane tym (w przypadku Mistrza balonów), że The Unfinished Swan nie do końca wspiera touchpada i nie można skakać i strzelać balonami jednocześnie. Po podłączeniu myszki sytuacja poprawiła się. Szkoda, że wpadłam na to po dużej dozie frustracji i niechęci do portów z konsol.

What Remains of Edith Finch jest jednym z najważniejszych i najpiękniejszych tytułów, w jakie grałam. Kiedy argumentuję, że gry nie są rozrywką - tylko nową formą sztuki, ten tytuł jest na liście moich przykładów. Dlatego z podekscytowaniem rozpoczęłam z przygodę z The Unfinished Swan. W starszej grze można znaleźć przebłyski geniuszu stojącego za epitafiami rodu Finchów. Ale było ich trochę za mało jak na mój gust. Pomimo całej baśniowości, gra może być za trudna i za straszna dla dzieci. Dla współczesnego użytkownika Steam, tytuł nie musi mieć już takiej świeżości, jaką miał lata temu podczas premiery na inną platformę. Może szkoda, że nie dane nam było zagrać wcześniej?
Więc komu mogę polecić The Unfinished Swan? Miłośnikom Giant Sparrow, którzy chcą się pobawić w archeologów i odnaleźć tropy prowadzące do arcydzieła, jakim jest What Remains of Edith Finch. I wszystkim, którzy chcą się dowiedzieć, co słychać u Miltona!
 
Jaghul
234 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Takurra
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juin 2023
여백의 미, 그리고 미완성

어두운 이야기였지만 그래픽과 참신한 텍스트 표현 방식을 이용한 'What Remains of Edith Finch' 이후에 내놓은 Giant Sparrow의 후속작인 'The Unfinished Swan'입니다.

게임의 이야기는 어머니를 잃고 고아가 되어버린 소년인 '먼로'의 시점으로 진행됩니다.
먼로의 어머니는 오로지 미완성된 그림만을 그렸으며 고아가 되어버린 먼로는 남긴 미완성 그림들 중 '미완성된 백조' 그림만을 가지고 고아원에서 지내게 됩니다. 고아원에서 먼로는 캔버스에서 살아난 미완성된 백조를 쫓아 빈 캔버스로 들어가 모험을 하게 됩니다. 그곳에서 먼로는 탐험을 하며 어머니와 아버지에 대해서 알게됩니다...

어드벤처 퍼즐 형식이며 특이하게 잉크라는 소재를 이용해서 퍼즐을 풀며 게임이 진행됩니다. 검은 잉크는 순백의 화면에 윤곽을 드러내게 하고 푸른 잉크는 물의 역할을 하며 식물을 키웁니다.
게임을 시작하면 완전히 하얀 세상에 플레이어는 잠시나마 당황하며 로딩창이 끝나지 않은 줄 알고 있습니다.
하지만 이윽고 버튼을 누르면 검은 잉크가 날아가며 세상을 채우는 것을 보고 5살 아이가 낙서하듯이 세상을 물들이며 길을 찾아 나아갑니다.

게임의 대부분은 이 잉크가 모든 상호작용을 하며 어느순간 색을 채우기 위해서 버튼을 난사하는 자신을 볼 수 있습니다.
넓은 세계에서 주인공이 길을 찾기 위해서는 백조의 발자국만이 게임의 진행을 알립니다.
얽매이지 않고 자유롭게 물들이고 넓은 화면에서 본다면 생각보다 아름다운 화면이 눈에 들어오며 모험을 하며 진행되는 이야기는 당신을 흥미롭게 만들겁니다.

단, 이 게임은 한글화가 되어 있지 않습니다. 도중마다 자체적으로 번역하며 진행하였지만 크게 어려운 이야기는 아니라하더라도 언어의 장벽이 있기에 주의해주시기 바랍니다.
또한 도전과제 중 'Minimalist'는 극악의 난이도를 자랑합니다...
유일하게 쓸 수 있는 잉크를 3방만을 제외하고 첫번째 스테이지를 클리어하면 도전과제가 완료되기에 눈을 감고 플레이하는 것과 같았으며 잦은 실수때문에 겨우 클리어하였습니다....

전작에선 너무나 어두운 이야기였으며 이번 작품 또한 솔직히 어두운 이야기라고 생각됩니다.
어머니를 잃고 고아가 되어버린 것과 더불어 이야기를 진행하면 부모님에 대해서 알게 되며 아버지를 알 수 있는대 이 또한 다양한 해석과 더불어 플레이어에게는 불만을 안겨줍니다.

그래도 나름 탄탄한 스토리의 전작과 더불어 동화같은 이야기의 이번 작품은 추천을 드리는 바입니다.

소년은 과연 어떤 결말을 맞이할까요...?


도전과제 완료 100%
2023년 06월 17일 4.9시간
 
알사탕

Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2023
The Unfinished Swan is a very short but enjoyable "puzzle" game. The puzzles aren't that hard and the story is fairly lighthearted and is basically a children's story. I really enjoyed my short time with this game. All achievements are fairly easy except one. If you end up missing collectibles, don't worry as after you collect as few you can go back and see which ones you missed in each chapter. It only took me about 3 hours to 100% this game. One completely blind run and then another with a guide for the last couple of achievements I needed.

Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2021
Very creative and beautiful little game. The paint mechanic is ingenious (even if it's unfortunately dropped in the final chapter), the architecture of each level is gorgeous to look at, and the story is short but focused. Not enough games end with such a strong final message of thematic intent as this one. It truly feels like a storybook.
 
Kermit the Forg
258 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2023
This honestly feels like a tech demo with an ok story attached to it. The throwing paintball gimmick is cute, but it gets VERY tedious and repetitive with the amount the game wants you to toss out. You'll spend half the game spamming the button just to see where you're going.

And on that note, the game is really hard on the eyes. A lot of the game is bright white and you have to paint your surrounding, but you can only paint it pitch black. The pitch white hurts visually, and the high contrast doesn't help. Later levels do away with this, but a few areas instead go into the pitch black surrounding where you can't see anything which isn't enjoyable either as you try to guess where to go next.

There's a vine growing mechanic for a few levels which is also cute, but also confusing. It's not always clear where the game wants you to go, and growing the vines is slow and tedious as you need to spam click and wait a long time. You're left spamming the paint button and waiting for the vine to grow in 5 different directions until you finally see where to go next. It could have been really charming is it was a little quicker and clear as to where the vines were going.

The game also seems to lock key elements as unlockable for no reason. If you paint the surrounding all black, you can't see. But the ability to clear thrown paint is not a default ability, instead requiring a few collectables to unlock. Why? Other than a bit of padding on a tech-demo, there's no reason for this.

All in all there's something here that could be turned into a cute 3h game. But currently its 3h of tedious gameplay and a few moments that made me go "oh huh nice" for about a minute or two. The story is serviceable, but its not amazing by any means. Even as a storybook tale for children it's not that good. For the $5 I spent on it, it was an OK 5/10.
 
Stuart
0
17 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

The first two chapters are great, but after that it gets weird and the whole atmosphere is not relaxing anymore and you just want to finish it.

In sum: a nice approach and interesting for one evening, but that`s it in my opinion.

The collection of the balloons is a nice feature but in fact not really necessary :D

Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2021
한글화가 되어 있지 않아 스토리적인 부분에서 여운을 느끼기는 어려웠으나,
그 외 부분에서는 굉장히 감탄했습니다.
다른 평가에서도 그렇듯 애매한 스토리, 애매한 구성, 애매한 퍼즐 같은 아쉬운 부분도 있었습니다.
다만 맵의 디자인이 눈을 즐겁게 해주었습니다. 챕터 2의 하얀색 왕국은 말이 필요없는 경치를 보여줍니다.
그리고 챕터 3에서 공을 이용해 벽을 만드는 부분이 인상깊었습니다.
게임을 다시 되돌아보면, 기억에 남는 장면들이 굉장히 많은 게임이긴하나,
이 게임이 말하고자하는 바가 무엇인지 제대로 와닿지 않는다는 점이 아쉽습니다.
플레이타임은 사람에 따라 다르지만 보통 2시간에서 3시간 사이쯤 되는데,
가볍게 즐길만한 게임이니 궁금하신 분들은 할인할 때 한 번 구매해서 플레이해보시는 것도 좋을 것 같습니다.
미완성을 완성하기 위한 과정이 담긴 The Unfinished Swan입니다.

If you played WRoEF and enjoyed Lewis and Milton's sections, you are most likely going to love this game.

Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 septembre 2020
I remember watching trailer to this game back in 2012 and I was like "well, that looks interesting", but I didn't have PlayStation (still don't lol) at that time, so I told myself I'm gonna play it one day.. so this day has come.

Plot is simple, somehow comic and cartoony, can't be taken seriously.
Puzzles are ok, but quite straightforward.
Music surrounding suits the game.

Pros:
  • Interesting concept of "invisible" labyrinth.
  • Calmy sound tracks and effects.
  • Secret hunting is fun and memorable.
♥♥♥♥:
  • Kinda short, feels like a demo, rather than full-game.
  • Lots of lost potential, feeling like level maker/challenges would make experience a way better.
  • Shooting white paint in black space was used in prototype but not in the main game.

I think this game worth a try, but better with good discount.
 
Birdie

Évaluation publiée le 30 octobre 2020
This did not age well, in my humble opinion. In 2012 (when it was first released), it would have been unique and original, but now... Basically it's Antichamber for kids. Tough sell to somebody who at the same time is playing Manifold Garden.
With that said, it could be fine, but for me personally the color splashing mechanic is just tiresome. For some reason reminded of the Memory of the Broken Dimension. That is tiresome and tedious as well, but it is supposed to be. And there are these endless collectables... No. But if you're thingking "Antichamba-what?" or "Fools Garden?", you may be surprised by this game.

Non recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 septembre 2020
Hatte gestern What Remains of Edith Finch gespielt und war total begeistert. Hierdurch bin ich auf The Unfinised Swan gestoßen.
Die Atmosphäre ist toll. Mir gefällt der minimalistische Grafikstil und die originelle Erzählweise.

Das Spielprinzip besteht aus einfachen Rätseln.

Die Geschichte ist wesentlich subtiler als in What Remains of Edith Finch und man kann dort viel hineininterpretieren. Ich persönlich konnte damit nicht viel anfangen.

Leider ist das Spiel in den 1,5 Stunden die ich zum Durchspielen ohne großes Erkunden gebraucht habe, viermal vollständig abgestürzt.

Da mir die Geschichte nicht sonderlich gefallen hat und die Rätsel mir einen Tick anspruchsvoller sein hätten können würde ich das Spiel keinem Freund zum Kauf empfehlen.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 octobre 2022
Lançado originalmente para Playstation 3 em 2012, The Unfinished Swan é um jogo em primeira pessoa que conta a história de um garoto, Monroe, que após ficar órfão e ir para um orfanato, vai em busca de um quadro de um cisne inacabado pintado pela sua mãe, que desapareceu.

A história da jornada desse garoto é contada como se fosse um livro de conto de fadas, com muitos elementos fantasiosos e abstratos, assim como provavelmente seria narrada se fosse por uma criança. São quatro capítulos ao todo.

A jogabilidade acompanha o abstracionismo da história, com um gameplay onde você começa em um cenário completamente branco e as únicas coisas que você pode fazer é pular e atirar bolas de tinta preta para todos os lados, revelando assim o cenário e podendo prosseguir. Conforme você progride na sua jornada, os cenários vão se modificando, e a jogabilidade começa a ter alguns pequenos puzzles para resolver, que são bem tranquilos e intuitivos.

O jogo não tem dublagem em Português do Brasil conforme está na página da loja, apenas em Português de Portugal. Contudo, a interface/legendas do jogo possuem tradução para o Português Brasileiro. Porém, eu recomendo que você modifique o idioma para o Português de Portugal, caso contrário ficará estranho acompanhar textos em Português Brasileiro com a dublagem em Português de Portugal. Não sei se é possível deixar a dublagem em outro idioma (como o Inglês) sem que isso altere toda a interface/legendas também.

O único ponto negativo é que o jogo é meio instável. O jogo crasha muito. Eu devo ter tido no mínimo uns quatro crashes na minha partida que nem durou 3 horas. A tela congela, o som continua reproduzindo mas os controles param de responder, levando a aquela famosa mensagem do Windows “The Unfinished Swan não está respondendo” e forçando você a ter que finalizá-lo. Comigo aconteceu aleatoriamente, e na maior parte das vezes quando uma cutscene era invocada.

Enfim, esse é um tipo de jogo que não é para qualquer um. Ele é um conto que usa elementos abstratos com uma jogabilidade em primeira pessoa, fazendo o jogador ter a sua própria interpretação da jornada e de seu desfecho.

Recomendo se você gosta desse tipo de “jogo artístico”, mas como o jogo é curto e possui crashes com muita frequência, espere por uma boa promoção.
 
Lord_Dracon

3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 septembre 2020
Rather short, cute, interesting gameplay-wise and aesthetically pleasing

The ‘world is your canvas’ mechanic really grabbed me from the start – navigating through the level with only your paint strokes (similarly to great Scanner Sombre ). I also liked how the new mechanics (which I won’t spoil) build on this idea.

For PC players:
You may want to increase your FOV by
🦢 Going to The Unfinished Swan\Media\SharedAssets\Scripts\
🎈 Open Player.lua
🎨 Find Camera_VerticalFovAngle = 50.54 and change to desired FOV value

1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2020
DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review

The Unfinished Swan is a game developed by Giant Sparrow, the same people that made the fantastic What Remains of Edith Finch and published by the wonderful people over at Annapurna Interactive

I'm not going to spoil anything in this review or say much, all I'm going to say is if you want a heartfelt story that explores a world created by an eccentric King

The gameplay is incredibly simplistic, just click the left mouse button multiple times to unveil the world with blobs of paint, but it really tugged on my heartstrings and is a wonderful game with some fantastic visuals, a great voice cast and an amazing soundtrack to boot

The Unfinished Swan is a wonderfully detailed, casual and incredibly simplistic from it's gameplay aspect but ultimately a wonderful and cute story

RECOMMENDED :)
THEPCGAMER'S BEST GAME IN STEAM LIBRARY! (What's this? :- Like some games get "Best Game of 2014" or "Best Indie Game", etc... So I have decided to make my own!)

REVIEW SOURCES:
  • None

Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2021
Been waiting to play this game since I saw a demo over 10 years ago, and short as it may be, this was worth the wait. Perfect anti-anxiety, low-stakes walking simulator with just enough puzzles and small challenges to keep you on your toes. The atmosphere is more cute than liminal but that's okay. Some mild philosophical musings, not too deep, just right. I really, really enjoyed this.
 
Makira
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2023
The unfinished swan is a game that tries to fill the same niche as something like journey, flower or abzu. But where those games shine with wonderful experiences, heartfelt stories or memorable sequences, the unfinished swan falls flat with a core premise that sounds interesting on paper, but in practice is more tedious than fun. Giving the world color as the only mechanic starts to feel bleak faster than you'd think. And even though each level tries to spice things up a bit, the gameplay isn't engaging enough to not just have it be a walking sim. The thing though with walking sims is that they have brilliant stories to tell, experiences that stick with you for a lifetime. The unfinished swan's plot is predictable and nonsensical and the payoff isn't worth sitting through the rather short runtime. The visuals are nice in the later levels but there's a lack of memorable setpieces that leave you in awe. Things like journey's slide level or finding the shark in abzu, there's none of that here. So in the end, the unfinished swan is a rather pale experience that whilst not overstaying its welcome, doesn't offer enough to make it worthwile at full price. The game regularly goes on a very steep sale though, and for that price and time investment its alright but nothing special.
 
D00mnoodle
174 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 février 2021
The Unfinished Swan is a masterfully crafted example of what games and the industry I think currently lacks. Even though the game isn't very long and it comes up short on the content department. It's deceptively simple and straightforward until the last leg of the journey when all the loose strings form a gorgeous bow. Gameplay mechanics are given to you without much explanation but, they don't need any. Within about 10 seconds or so of playing around with any new skill you'll instantly become an expert. My appreciation for the lack of explanation is such a high light for me since most games tend to hold your hand. On top of that, you have these incredibly interwoven levels that are so enjoyable it's almost like playing a Disney movie. I hope this game doesn't fly under the radar for too much longer it's such a wonderful little gem. Highly original, all-ages friendly, and so easy to pick up and understand. Unfortunately, I do think that $15 maybe a bit steep for about a 2 hr run time. However, I do think it's worth your time and money since there is some replay value in some of the extras you can obtain. I'll happily give this game an 85/100 for how much enjoyment I got out of it.
 
Shock Jockey

2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 septembre 2020
An excellent proof-of-concept that doesn't find its "voice" until the very final stage. I'm glad that I stuck with it, but I can't, in good faith, recommend it to others as something they might enjoy. Much of it is a slog, and at 2 hours in length, that's a serious flaw. Nevertheless, the design ideas are smart (and in some cases truly revelatory). In other words, this game is only worth your time if you are interested in game design.

Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2023
A unique and interesting way of telling a story. Start with a completely white 3d canvas and use paintballs to unveil the world around you. Later chapters add shadows and other visible items.

The story itself is extremely simple though and so is the game. The game can be finished easily in one evening, ignoring the achievements.

Yes, it's from the same makers as Edith Finch, but this one doesn't even come close.
Simple and short. Still cool though.

Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2023
Erm.. this is advertised as being by the team behind the amazing, gobsmacking, jaw dropping "WRoEF", probably one of the best walking sims of its time.

This feels... like the student project they would release BEFORE that amazing other game?

It's very short, and i wouldn't mind if it wasn't for the fact that most of the time is spent clicking your mouse like a madman, trying to 'echo locate' yourself in the dark.

There are four locations in total, with 3 game mechanism. That's really little to go buy. Sure they look good, but it's nothing out of the ordinary by 2020 standards. Yes it's stylish and enchanting, but it's not 'captivating'.

I'm sorry, no. There are much better options - buy "WROFEF" instead if you want a really good , original and poignant walking sim. This is maybe better suited for (monitored) playing with young children.
 
Adidas
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2023
TLDR Creative, lightweight and surprisingly pleasant despite the audacious premise, the only downside is how short it is. [18/20⭐, 4h🏅, 1/5💡]

Context The Unfinished Swan follows a boy exploring (and messing with) his father’s attempts to create something to be remembered by. Although technically a shooter, it plays as a creative and “artistic” exploration game, with each chapter exploring a different mechanics. You can see some of the ideas that were later perfected by the team in What Remains of Edith Finch, although not as impressive or ambitious.

Writing The boy is in a quest to find out more about his father after his mother’s death - the titular swan being an unfinished painting left her. The plot is told as a fairytale as the kid interprets his father’s story, so despite the gloomy premise it’s cute and whimsical, without taking itself too seriously. What Remains of Edith Finch players may recognise the king as a member of the Finch family.

Aesthetics The game is all about the experience - it starts in a literally all white room where you have to shoot paint to fathom some details. It’s so preposterous that it shouldn’t work, but it does, and the best moments are when you look back at all the mess you made throughout the level. The soundtrack is top-notch and fitting for the ambience of each chapter. The voice acting is a bit exaggerated, but it makes sense as the story being read to a child.

Gameplay The gameplay is simple, it’s essentially a shooter where the projectiles have a different effect in the environment depending on the chapter. Progress is mostly through exploration, although there are some straightforward puzzle and action sequences. You can die, but you’ll just respawn in the last position. The game auto-saves after each level, but the level progress is not saved.

Value It took me 4h to complete the game, which is rather short but understandable for a game where each chapter plays as a unique experience. There is a single progress slot, but you can revisit previous chapters from the menu. Achievements are mostly straightforward, and related to finding hidden collectibles (and a slightly tricky one for minimal shots).

For more puzzle-game reviews and curated lists check out the Puzzle Trove.
 
macwh

GymUnicorn
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2022
„Bílá pírka snů.“

Malý Monroe nemá šťastné dětství – tatínka nikdy nepoznal a maminka mu nedávno navždy odešla. Zůstal mu po ní jen malý obrázek krásné labutě, avšak nedokončený. Jedné noci se Monroe probouzí, a překvapeně zjišťuje, že labuť kamsi zmizela. Záhy si všimne jejích stop, vedoucích k malým otevřeným dvířkům, o kterých dosud neměl ani tušení. Opatrně do nich vstupuje a ocitá se v podivuhodném království, které je však zcela opuštěné. Vyráží tak na dobrodružnou výpravu, s cílem vystopovat ztracenou labuť, a možná i odhalit zdejší tajemství...

Tento titul z roku 2012, vznikl ve studiu Giant Sparrow, stojící také za hrou What Remains of Edith Finch. V roli malého chlapce, vás čeká průchod opuštěným královstvím, v podobě několika samostatných lokací. V nich postupně narážíte na nenáročné prostorové hádanky, které budete řešit pomocí jednoduché mechaniky – házením tekutých kuliček. Na začátku hry, slouží takto vzniklé kaňky, především k odhalování skrytého okolí. Postupem času, však tyto kuličky získávají další funkce, které využijete k překonávání nových překážek.

S tím souvisí i nejsilnější stránka hry, kterou je čistota jejího designu. Nic zde nepřebývá, ani nepřekáží – vše je navrženo velice prostě a účelně. Výsledkem je nadmíru příjemný zážitek, bez zbytečných záseků a bezradného tápání. Ti méně zkušení, se tak mohou spolehnout na nenápadné vedení, ti zkušenější, se pak dočkají přehlídky tvůrčí vynalézavosti. I přes vizuální jednoduchost, se navíc autorům daří vytvářet okouzlující výjevy, nad kterými se místy až tají dech. To vše, je ještě umocněno povedenou atmosférou, vyvolávající pocit osamění i naděje...

Pokud tedy máte náladu na krásnou malou hru, plnou nevšedních přístupů, pak máte mé doporučení.

Další recenze na mé kurátorské stránce
 
Bionick
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2022
子供のころに母が読み聞かせてくれた絵本の世界、まるでそんな幻想的な世界観を味わうゲーム。
あなたはモンローという少年を操作して、色の無い世界で白鳥を追って歩き回ることになる。

ゲーム性が全く違うのであくまで例として挙げるが、UndertaleやInscriptionなどと同じように、事前知識をあまり入れずに遊ぶことがおすすめされるゲーム。
プレイしないと味わえない感覚、みたいなふわっとしたやつがあるタイプ。

謎解き自体は詰まるレベルの難易度のものはほとんどなく、２～３時間程度でクリアできるボリューム。
世界観やストーリーを楽しむゲームとして、ストアページのゲーム画面を見て惹かれる人には間違いなくお勧めできる。あんまり普段ゲームをやらない人でも、このボリュームなら遊びやすいだろう。

Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2020
It's no Edith Finch, but it has a similar charm. Compared to Edith Finch, this game feels targeted towards a younger audience, with "picture book" story telling elements as you progress. If you haven't played What Became of Edith Finch, you should definitely play that.

Cool mechanics, very creative game play if a bit on the easy side. Hidden balloons to find if you are the completionist type. Very short and sweet. Can't wait for Giant Sparrow's next game
