Cerebus
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2020
I went into 'The Unfinished Swan' with the understanding that it had something to do with throwing ink to reveal objects in the environment -- which was cool -- but boy was I delighted to find that the game opens up into so much more. It's an absolutely creative and heartwarming experience, one I wouldn't want to spoil for anyone.

Note: the game runs flawlessly w/ as high of a frame rate as your monitor will support. With v-sync 'off' I was reaching well over 500fps, and 'on' I was locked to a silky smooth 120fps. Only noting this as another reviewer mentioned getting motion sick, and I have a difficult time understand how.

Fakku
769 produits enregistrés
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mai 2021
Hard miss, which is unfortunate given how much I liked their previous game.

The white on black in the first level hurts my eyes. Turn down the brightness?
Now it's even harder to make out where everything is from lack of contrast.

The mechanics are just spamming paint everywhere which hurts my hand - I was expecting something a bit more relaxing. This would entirely be a non-issue if holding down the mouse just shot paint in bursts rather than forcing you to spam-click.

The first puzzle is just unintuitive guesswork. I have no idea if I'm skipping missable collectables since you're lacking depth / blind as a bat for aesthetics: form over function. You need to shoot paint to see ceilings, floors, walls, etc, but if there's too much paint you then have the opposite problem where it blends together and since you need to shoot paint to move objects - but physics is wonky since objects collide with terrain - there's paint EVERYWHERE and you can't unpaint something so there's a definitive threshold of clarity vs time you'll pass real quick.

What little of the art I saw in the introduction sequence was nice, the narration is really nice, I felt a spark of childhood magic again for a bit there, but ♥♥♥♥ if it isn't just a frustrating mix of visual clutter and RSI.
 
★ÅƦŁƎʗϾԨꞁꞂῼ☆

玩久的话会有点晕……但是还是很推荐啦

Évaluation publiée le 28 octobre 2020
Would I recommend Unfinished Swan? Yes but not for full price. At around 3 hours gameplay this is one you want to pick up when it is (inevitably) on sale.

As a walking simulator/exploration/puzzle type game it's got some interesting ideas that I've not seen before, especially early on, but the final "message" of the story falls a bit flat for me.
 
BouncingCzech
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 février 2023
This is a childhood game in which I remember spending many hours replaying the demo version repeatedly on the PS3, and I still find myself humming the soundtrack and going back to those times of no cares in the world.

Fast forward nearly 10 years later and I still haven't gone past the first level. Not because I can't or don't have enough time to, but because after completing the level, I pause, reminiscing on how my younger self would often feel disappointed, hear that beautiful soundtrack, then tell myself, "Maybe I missed an easter egg or two." while I exit out and hit new game all over again.

gggertyuigfh
187 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2022
Play as Monroe, a young boy recently orphaned and left with a paintbrush and single painting of a swan his mother never finished. In his first night in the orphanage, before going to bed, the swan leaves the frame and goes through a magical door that mysteriously appeared. Enter a white kingdom, splatter paint to find your way and follow the swan.

Not only is this game massively disappointing, it inspires headaches and motion sickness. The puzzles are barely that, the story is 1-3+hours long, unremarkable, the ending was inadequate, and the only reason I can think of why this game has so many positive reviews is because it’s a side story of a character in What remains of Edith Finch, Milton Finch. There is an open ending and aside from showing you what happened to Milton you learn absolutely nothing about the character you play as or interesting story elements that were shown in gameplay.
If the puzzles were better, I could give this a positive review, but they are so mind-numbingly easy you can complete them without realizing they were supposed to be an obstacle. In one notable example, you are shown this huge and elaborate maze, and I was actually excited to see and explore it to find more story text, but once you enter it, you teleport to the finish line, and you move on to the next chapter. I wish I refunded this game then.
 
Zelrune
437 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2020
Lang hat es gedauert, aber letztlich hat es doch noch den Schritt auf den PC geschafft. Für mein dafürhalten ist es gut gealtert, der minimalistische Grafikstil hilft dabei doch enorm. Insofern hält sich auch die Belastung des Rechenknechts stark in Grenzen.

Spielerisch ist es durchaus interessant, zumindest am Anfang. Letztlich ist es jedoch realtiv simpel und einfach. Gut für Einsteiger oder Personen die noch nicht viel Erfahrung mit First Person Rätselspielen hatten, aber wer durch Portal oder ähnlichem durch kam, wird hier kaum eine Herausforderung finden - nicht mal bei den kleineren Hüpfpassagen.

Pouyaaaa
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2021
The preview does not do this game justice. Very interesting concept. There is a bit of a story that unfolds as you go. You use color (paint splashes, water splashes, etc) to uncover (or cover) the walls, floors and ceiling to reveal pathways and objects in order to navigate through the game. Frustrating at first as it was not intuitive. But I was literally drawn into the game and ended up very much enjoying it. Yes - Recommended.

游戏机制简单又很妙，通过喷射黑色颜料探索环境，用喷溅的效果显示空间物体的边界，从而通过全白的环境揭露叙事的内容。一些门可以用颜料砸开，特别有惊喜的感觉；有的物体，比如路灯，可以截图出很好看的效果，还挺有成就感的，唯一的问题就是它加重了我多年的3D眩晕症(!!!)，以及一直喷喷喷，视觉和音效都有一点开始枯燥，如果能多一些像隐藏门一样的彩蛋就好了。

我要休息一下。

It's hard to find anything wrong with this game. The story is relatively simple, yet engaging. The game is visually appealing. As described: "Enter the surreal world of The Unfinished Swan and explore a mysterious, hidden kingdom by splatting paint to reveal the world around you."
The first level was this...and it was fun!

Xtaroth
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2020
A delightful little game with a simple, but very unique and interesting game mechanic: Painting the environment as you go -- in different ways.

The first five minutes were kind of uninteresting, until I stopped and looked back at the trail of paint I had left behind which created a very beautiful outline of the level. This made me smile, and gave me a feeling of joy that I rarely get from games.

The game does not try to overstay its welcome, and I would say the playtime of about 1.5-3 hours is a good length, since I don't think the idea could have been stretched much further. It is not difficult (although there was a puzzle or two that became a little bit frustrating to complete), and if you like short, relaxing games that are different from the rest, this is definitely one to try out.
 
Voodoo Dragon

Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2020
感谢大麻雀和Annapurna Interactive，又推出了一件新艺术品之作！
虽然游戏画面和品质比起我的挚爱艾迪芬奇相对而言没有如此精良，作为同样的开发商发行商的再度联合，本应是在要环境场景下更精巧才对，这次的场景于我更像是在艾迪芬奇中哥哥抑郁章节那部分的城堡场景的放大版【还是色彩过度简化版】多少是有些缺憾。

Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2021
Я из тех кто переиграл во все что только можно, и мне уже все остоп.и.здило вот и искал чего нибудь необычного - механика с красками даже сейчас свежо выглядит и играется. Игра как концепт хороша, но выглядит недоделанной. Но на этом все плюсы заканчиваются. В остальном абсолютно скучная игра. Но не настолько чтобы не рекомендовать ее. Возможно кому то зайдет.
Ходим медленно, читаем сюжет уровня 4 класса, и стреляем шариками краски и воды чтобы понимать куда идти и что вообще перед нами - стена или проход.
Оказывается что это первая игра от разработчиков богомерзкой Edith Finch, от иди.о.тского сюжета той я до сих пор плююсь. Эта в 100 раз лучше финч.
Но мне не зашла, Refund.

ima talk about the ending but not directly spoiling whats gonna happen.
there is one problem with the game in my opinion, its the ending, the game was so great that they couldn't cope up with the ending, what im trying to say is the game should've stayed unfinished, i see it as a better ending, that game is one of the best, but also it was so great the ending wasn't satisfying, just imagine making a story so great you can't end it right, im just repeating the same thing back and forward, but i see the ending being unfinished is better than the original ending, because it leaves the player imagining what could've happened, having an open ending and fans doing theories is better in my opinion. so it should've ended with an open ending than a normal ending.

Khaintra
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
58.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2023
Gameplay: Think Splatoon with puzzle elements. Until it decides to change the rules.

Lots of things annoyed me about this game. After one day of playing it, I had repetitive strain injury. For 85% of the game you are doing the exact same thing and it gets pretty tedious.

It's one of those games that changes the rules to suit itself. You're prevented from doing things you should be able to do, purely because the game needs that to be the case at the time.

No autosave, which is a MFer when you're trying to clear/fully explore a level. The game will tell you it's saving, but if you die, you'll go back further than that point. I don't know that I've ever had a game mislead me about a save point before.

This didn't feel fully realised as a concept, or in practice. It felt like the story was abandoned halfway though. I don't feel like I learned anything about the characters. All in all, bum.
I could only recommend it for a couple of quid.
 
caitlyn_bree
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2021
I watched the credits. The credits screen is as long as a AAA tile such as Assassin's Creed. You'd think with all of those people involved in making this short game that it wouldn't freeze or crash at all. If this was an indie game by a small team of 10 people but still had the occasional freeze/crash bug? Okay, I could accept that. This game, however, appears to have had hundreds of people involved in its production and the game froze shortly after starting the second chapter. For a ~3 hour game by such a large team of people, it should be thoroughly polished until it shines like a sexy bald head that's been recently oiled.

Non recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 janvier 2021
Coming from What Remains of Edith Finch that was amazing experience this one became quickly dissappointment.

Not my cup of tea at all. Instead emotional story it is motion sickness simulator with random shooting black bubbles in monochromatic world and simple fairytale on background.

I am not into such kind of art - maybe if it would better capture the painting in full color instead just tedious random shooting I would enjoy it better. The aggresivity of bright light against my eyes did not helped either. Would advise look carefully on what this game has to offer and how it looks.

Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2020
Um jogo curioso. É um FPS-narrativo-walking-simulator com uma historinha poética e uma mecânica bem interessante mas que não se sustenta muito. Vale a pena se você for o tipo de pessoa que consegue ocasionalmente curtir jogos mais por eles serem "interessantes" do que realmente super bons.

Não sei se recomendo ou não, mas vou marcar que não só porque tenho que marcar alguma coisa para fazer um review e porque, honestamente, tem jogos muito melhores nessa mesma vibe.
 
Bracht
282 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 octobre 2023
A very beautiful and philosophical tale about providence and broadening your horizons. This game makes me feel in a way that we are very much limited by our own perspectives, and that all we need to see is that there are so many unexplored possibilities all around us that we haven't even considered. I'm just a few mini chapters into the game, and I plan on continuing, but what I've come to realize from my short play-through is the important meaning of remaining open to possibilities. There will be, for example, a room you're in and unless you've explored it with the paint balls, you have no idea that that room has a chandelier, a stairway, and a balloon in it. If you remain narrow-minded, and focused on getting from point A to point B in a short amount of time, you'll miss the forest for the ink-splattered trees.
 
Psalmofmercy

empty-field
149 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2020
An artsy game with very little art or game present. Gameplay primarily involves walking slowly and spamming mouse clicks to throw paint around to either 1) see where you're even going or 2) force puzzle solutions to do what you want. There's intentionally very little artstyle present in the game because most of the game is designed around being eye-searing white, and that combined with the lack of FoV settings gave me actual nausea. Not worth $15, especially for a game that's under 2 hours.
 
Railgun5
1,893 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 octobre 2020
I generally enjoy exploration games which are somewhat arty, but this game just didn't do it for me.

The story is childish and dull, those reviewers who describe this game as 'captivating literature' need to get a grip, I'm afraid.

The (single) gameplay mechanic is strange and sometimes unintuitive. The per-level mechanics (vines, lights, block-building) are a little random and don't build on each other.

It starts very intriguingly (the first 10 minutes are cool), but after that the game feels like a collection of arty demos which have been stuck together.

The one thing I would say is that this game is oddly pretty. The vines in particular are very nice to look at and play with.

This might be something for you if you enjoy arty childlike adventures where the gameplay mechanics don't matter to you... but for me it's a no.
 
Zwitterion
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2021
Arachnophobes beware: THERE IS A SPIDER LEVEL.

Everything is either really bright or pitch black, so it's a bit hard on the eyes. Disappointing after playing 'What Remains of Edith Finch' and looking for more. Was not worth the sale price.

This might have been a decent game, but I only played 20 minutes of it before getting a refund. I grew sick of this very quickly because the only gameplay is throwing paint and attempting to navigate. Perhaps it changes, but I get terrible motion sickness, so 20 minutes of throwing paint was enough to make me want to vomit. I think I'd rather return the game and allow others to play it for themselves.

Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2022
very short art game but of course a playstation classic nonetheless.
only thing they changed in this pc port are the menus. no cutscene or image texture remasters.
if you've always wanted to play it but have never had a ps3/psvita/ps4 or really want to experience this game again (and don't mind the $15 cost) then this is probably the way to go.
luckily this game could easily be done in less than two hours so you can refund it right after if you're left unsatisfied.
 
t
205 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juin 2022
It is just super boring to be honest. The gameplay is pedestrian -- it is more of a walking simulator than the puzzle game I was expecting from the information on the steam page. The game basically consists of you spamming the "throw paintball-thing" button hundreds or even thousands of times. It is just really repetitive.

There is a story accompanying the constant walking & throwing, but I don't much care for it. Seems exceedingly generic about a sad boy who learns to see the world in color -- the game is a visual metaphor for this as the world starts out black & white and gradually increases to a more colorful canvass.

TLDR -- I would avoid this one. If you want a puzzle game, there are a myriad of other puzzle games out there with more in depth mechanics or fun factor. If you want a walking simulator, just play What Remains of Edith Finch by the same studio ironically. The Unfinished Swan is just a perverse amalgamation of the two genres that just doesn't work.
 
Cam The Man
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 décembre 2021
I've played a few Annapurna games, and they are gorgeous and thoughtful. I have really enjoyed my experiences with them, but they are also short. They tell interesting stories, but then it's over.

The Unfinished Swan is another like this. I do enjoy it, and I do recommend it, but not at full price. I completed the game in 2-3 hours. Spent some additional time trying to get all the balloons, but it became too tedious to go for 100% completion, and there's no other real reason to keep playing. Keep that in mind for yourself when deciding to buy or not. With that out of the way, the game looks great and is a very neat, novel puzzle experience, and I did have fun with my time in it.

I think the first chapter was the most challenging with regard to the puzzles, and the later chapters overall didn't add a lot of new mechanics (some,. but the experience was actually easier). With the exception of the final chapter, there's no urgent drive to solve quickly, so you can just enjoy the experience. After starting the game that way, the final areas, which introduced a "timer" mechanic, were a little jarring.

There are a few little easter eggs to find, and some of the balloons are really tricky, even with the end game toy, but still not worth more than 1-2 playthroughs.
 
Gaffi

2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2021
It's not apparent from the Steam release; but this game was made for the console market back in 2012 when artistic games were rarer and held to a low standard accordingly. One of Annapurna's weaker games.

The visuals are not compelling (bordering on ugly); the puzzle mechanics are limited in range (and trivial); the story is uninteresting (and very short). I expect to forget this game within days of finishing it.

C3ph1r4
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 septembre 2020
«Незаконченный Лебедь» – это вторая игра от инди-студии Giant Sparrow, создавшей несколько лет назад нашумевший симулятор ходьбы What Remains Of Edith Finch, хотя фактически она вышла раньше на мыльной консоли и является дебютом разработчиков. И вот аж 5 лет спустя её выпустили на ПК, и давайте посмотрим, чем «Гигантский Воробей» изначально привлекал внимание аудитории и чем решил привлечь вновь.
Как и в случае с историей Эдит Финч, перед нами – симулятор ходьбы, разбавленный очень жиденькими и простенькими головоломками. Мы играем за мальчика, имя которого я забыл, как только выключил игру, так что извиняюсь. Его мать-художница умерла, он взял в детский дом одну её незаконченную картину с лебедем (скажите мне кто-нибудь, какой художник будет рисовать голову и тело лебедя отдельно???), после чего одной ночью обнаружил в стене нового жилища поход в сказочную страну, а в своих руках – возможность управлять краской и это самое царство фантазий ею преображать.
По поводу сюжета можно сказать коротко: он тут никакой. История о создавшем и потом забросившем этот мир короле, которая подаётся разбросанными там и сям отрывками (хотя озвучка у них, да ещё и на русском, приятная, тут респект), не впечатляет и даже редкую улыбку вызывает еле-еле. Даже до истории Туборга (кто поймёт, тот поймёт) из «Не Верь в Худо» она ну никак не дотягивает. Главный герой вообще связан с королём, его ушедшей королевой и этим миром как-то очень опосредованно, и выглядит всё это какой-то не доведённой до ума и не сработавшей метафорой. Усугубляет невнятность происходящего ещё и неуклюжее ломание четвёртой стены, которое скорее походит на неудачную шутку.
К большому разочарованию, геймплей тут такой, что честное слово, лучше бы его не было и надо было бы просто полтора часа идти вперёд. С помощью краски (а затем воды) мы вообще находим путь, покрывая белое пространство кляксами, потом направляем растущие растения и карабкаемся по ним, взаимодействуем с механизмами и так далее. То есть вам приходится буквально постоянно кликать мышкой просто чтобы увидеть путь, а когда появляются растения и необходимость направлять их рост (который, того хуже, имеет искусственные границы, хотя до этого нам рассказали, как эти лианы обвили буквально весь город), это превращается ещё и в долбаный пиксельхантинг. При этом сами головоломки совершенно очевидны, в них нет ни намёка на сложность, поэтому и без того простейший игровой процесс становится невыносимо тоскливым занудством.
Цветовое минимализм и очерченная геометрия вкупе с разбрызгиваемыми кляксами, безусловно, выглядят стильно и местами могут подарить пару красивых скриншотов. Но у такого графического решения есть и обратная сторона; в последней трети игры вы путешествуете по практически абсолютной темноте от одного источника света к другому (а кое-где ещё и на время) без возможности не то что осветить, но хотя бы обозначить себе путь ЧЁРНОЙ краской, от чего постоянно упираетесь в тупики, падаете и тонете.
Пожалуй, визуальный стиль, если не брать в расчёт его техническое приложение, и неплохой, местами даже атмосферный саундтрек – единственные заметные плюсы сего произведения. А в остальном The Unfinished Swan – это скучный, безыдейный и абсолютно ненужный проходняк. Я всегда исключительно за креатив и оригинальный подход, если только они не делают из игры бестолковую инсталляцию, за стоимость которой можно купить любую из частей Half-Life (не считая выкидыша для VR). И какими бы личными переживаниями сценариста не были подкреплены идеи, заложенные в эту игру, они, как и шея заглавной птицы, увы, остались незавершёнными.
Оценка: 5 из 10 – посредственно.
 
Condor Freedman
552 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2020
One of my favourite games of all time! I played it back when I had a PS3 for five minutes, and loved it then. Just last week I was looking to see if it had been released for PC yet, and here it is!

I love this game, and even though it's not a difficult game the challenges are just set right with the whole allegorical nature of the thing. Wonderful art style. Really a joy to look at and splatter!

It's a short game. I 100% everything in 6.5 hours. Still worth every penny for an unforgettable experience.

CiccioCc

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2021
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF YOU ARE LEFT-HANDED. DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. GAME. IF. YOU. ARE. LEFT. HANDED. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF YOU ARE LEFT-HANDED.

Not only does this game inexplicably have no ability to remap keys, which is already unforgivable, but it doesn't respect AutoHotKey settings. I have literally never seen a game that deadass ignores AHK inputs before today. Like, I am almost impressed. Someone needed to consciously force the game to refuse to let us play it with keyboard settings that work for us. Some right-handed person hates us so much that they rooted around in the code somewhere with the express aim of making the game worse.

I found a thread about this issue here, but of course it was too late for me because I naively assumed that a game that came out in the twenty-first century would have keyboard remapping. I am so disappointed. Annapurna should be better than this. Be better than this.
 
MoonLayHidden

Recommandé
11.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2021
A properly artistic game with an immersive world and beautiful soundtrack.
That being said it was also disappointing to see so many opportunities wasted. I felt like so much more could have been done with the color mechanics and the levels. The game felt a little short, almost as if it ended right when it was getting on a roll.
Some of the achievements are fairly frustrating as well, such as having to go through a level completely blind. All that it requires is a lot of time investment to "map out" a path during a proper playthrough and them mimic it going in blind. It's nothing but a time waster.

Regardless, I this is a pleasant litle game and its potential ties to "What remains of Edith Finch" makes it a good storytelling experience.

Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2023
Was gifted this game after having it on my wishlist for a couple months, and within the first 20 minutes of playing it bugged out twice on me. Some parts of the map are unfinished, and standing in those spots or misinterpreting directions drops you into the floor & plays a godawful noise; much like an old school TV on a no-signal channel. The story line and general premise of the game seem very interesting, but unfortunately putting my ears through the unnecessary torture isn't worth it.

Roboapple
1,066 produits enregistrés
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 septembre 2020
The Unfinished Swan is a pleasant game that takes a decent weekend to beat. It is made by the company that made What Remains of Edith Finch. The game is very unique using a paint brush in order to paint your level. It makes each person’s playthrough unique. Each person will paint the level in as much detail as they want. Each level was unique, playing off a certain gimmick. The first had a completely white canvas that you filled in, the second was more defined with more platforming and the 3rd level had a more dark color palette. The music and graphics were both pleasant. The story was simple, but told a good story about leaving a legacy. Overall the game was fun and pleasant, but nothing about it completely blew me away 6/10

Valou
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 septembre 2020
It's funny this game plays with visual themes of light and dark because it sits squarely in the shadow of What Remains of Edith Finch. That's a tough game to follow up and It's difficult to not form expectations for this game if you've played Edith Finch. This is a perfectly good experience in isolation. I didn't mind it. It certainly felt like the right length and it kept the gameplay mostly fresh throughout. my one major criticism is forcing the player to look at things. Not good. Bad game dev! Bad!!! I really hate that!!! it makes my eyes feel weird and I don't like it!!! I will see your game!!! All I'm doing is seeing your game!!! If the gameplay is looking around and shooting paint, don't take over 50% of it because you really want me to see what this chapter is called!!!!! it's only annoying!!!! I'll see it!!!!! I promise!!!!

I completed this game in one sitting and I actually did feel like I had my time wasted so I'm not going to recommend it. It felt like it didn't really have anything meaningful to say and I certainly don't remember anything past the king's terrible English accent and the first level with the paint throwing. I'm glad I got it on sale or I'd refund it but honestly it felt more like a waste of time than a waste of money. I'm not gonna refund because I do want to support this dev but this is not a good game imo.
 
BleepFox
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2022
Terribly bad game design that would make you so much motion sickness.

There is a white screen, the only way you can see the world is throwing a black water ball that splatter the world, but if you too much throw the ball you could hardly see the world because the screen was just changed black from white, so you need to control how much ball you need to throw. You have no idea how long your ball is going, like sometimes your ball hit a wall immediately after you throwing or it goes down into a hole after a second, those unexpected result made me so much uncomfortable and feel sick.

I quit after 5 minutes playing because of motion sickness so maybe in the later game the situation will be changed, but I gave up with no regret. As I've requested the refund already, you could understand if your brain would be ok with the game then request the refund if not. The dev should've focus on making a story telling walking simulator instead of this, and I would rather play What Remains of Edith Finch again.

Évaluation publiée le 25 mars 2021
I didn't prefer the young/reading to a child-feeling storytelling style, and the puzzles were not what I was looking for in a puzzle game. The moral of the story is extremely heavy handed, which makes me wonder if I played a young kids' game accidentally and am unfairly reviewing.
This is a reasonably pretty storybook walking simulator that I was able to finish, and if that's what you want it'll probably go well.

From Annapurna I found Journey, gorogoa, gone home to be more compelling, and sayonara wild hearts and outer wilds knocked it out of the park.

I asked for a refund, but was refused, since I bought this along with Edith Finch, and apparently even though I had only played this one for a few minutes, the fact that I had played the other one for longer meant that I couldn't get a refund for this one.

Non recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2023
I'm giving a mixed review, but for the sake of posting I'm giving a thumbs down. Note: This review is preliminary as I have yet to finish the story.

I don't consider myself motion sick since only two games I've played makes me wanna throw up. Unfortunately The Unfinished Swan is one. The very first chapter is by far the worst, splatting colors in a pure white environment while your head is on a swan's neck by pivoting everywhere is NOT helping.

As for the story, I didn't expect this game to pass the impossibly high bar that is What Remains of Edith Finch, but even with a lowered expectation the story it failed. Cutscenes are few and far in between, revealing barely any story before forcing you on a trek in a monotonous world.

However, I will update this review as I see fit as I progress.

Hawk
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juillet 2022
Simon in the Land of Chalk Drawings
Monroe 
Création de la communauté pour The Unfinished Swan
Par : zaphodikus

You are Monroe Finch, its probably not spoiling it but you play as a young boy, exploring a kingdom created by a young prince, with a paintball gun. Simple yet innovative puzzles abound in this game which tells a story of love, laziness, fear and loss. It kept reminding me of this 70's children's toon
Vidéo YouTube™: Simon in the land of chalk drawings 11 episodes 
Vues : 5,450
.

Everything is White
You walk about in a scene where you have to throw black balls of paint in order to uncover the obstacles and trigger machines, and as the balls change colour and effect, also trigger machines and plants that move. It's a bit parkour at times, but actually not hard at all.

Eventually the world goes black, and the black balls of paint, really have no effect. You (or rather the young Monroe) must fight for your life to escape many terrors as you traverse an immense maze of a city. Oh, and did I mention, all the while you are following an incompletely-drawn swan who helps you, just a little. Sometimes there are imperceptible wind chimes that guide me, almost as in a dream, but this is no dream for Monroe.

Immensely satisfying game, puzzle learning curve development is perfect, difficulty and scale are too. If you enjoyed Before Your Eyes, you will love this title. To find similar titles check out one of my lists here.
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41773079-EmpathyGames/list/91358/
 
zaphodikus
795 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

_d!s†rey

הברבור הלא גמור
 
ben bennings
500 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2021
Visuals and audio are great. Gameplay is unironically walking simulator. If the walking speed was doubled or you were given a run button it would maybe be a very slight recommendation.

But the walking speed is so damn slow I literally didn't even want to explore. I would see a collectible just across the room in plain sight and literally think "nope too far away, not worth it"

Also, the story isn't particularly compelling and the "puzzles" are trivial.

Felt like I had enough after about 15 minutes, only played another 30 minutes to see if it would change in any significant way, and it didn't. Full playthrough based on other reviews seems to only be about 2-3 hours so I think I seen more than enough to know I'm not missing anything, and neither are you. Watch the trailer, see the cool visuals, and then go buy a different game.
 
Vantier

yellowhite

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2023
Produit remboursé

The Unfinished Swan became the unfinished game. After 15 minutes of the mind-numbing activity of hurling a paintball I just couldn't stomach any more. I literally got nauseous from motion sickness playing this game. Beyond that it was incredibly boring. Slowly throw 10 paintballs take two steps and and throw another 10 paintballs ad nauseam. I did read it gets better after the first chapter but when I found out there was a labyrinth coming up I completely lost all interest. Maybe people with more patience and an iron stomach can handle it.

I like the game as it's not something you see all the time. It's different because it's a paint perspective. It's a hidden world for you to explore and all you have to do it throw a little color to gain perspective. It's a bit glitchy here and there, but nothing a restart won't fix. I love this game.

Non recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2020
I bought this expecting the same quality of quirky and immersive story telling that I got from What Remains of Edith Finch. What I got instead was a clicking simulator. The gameplay is not married well to the story. The unique mechanics are either used once in passing and then forgotten, or stretched to its utmost to the point of exhaustion.
Buy this game if you enjoy watching plants grow, because that is what I spent half of the game time doing.

SUNBOY YO
122 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 septembre 2020
I'm writing this as a big fan of What Remains of Edith Finch (from the same developers). The Unfinished Swan is a beautiful and well-crafted experience. Everything works well and you can really tell a lot of thought went into every detail. THAT SAID, it is a bit too "artsy-fartsy" for my taste: the story is (deliberately) simple and it didn't really grip me. This could be excused if the gameplay was extremely interesting, which it isn't. It does feel somewhat satisfying to use paint to reveal your path, but that's about it. The game tries to throw some variety to this main mechanic, but most of it ends up feeling dull after a while - or even downright annoying (I'm looking at you, vine sections).

I can see this game appealing to more sensitive souls than my own, but if you're looking for something as engaging and fresh as What Remains of Edith Finch, you won't find it here. I recommend other walking simulators such as SOMA and Tacoma.
 
GoldSkulltulaHunter

Non recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2022
This game is a toddler's conception of an artsy walking simulator and a genuine disappointment considering the genius of What Remains of Edith Finch. Edith finch was a mature, nuanced tale about legends, loss, and tragedy disguised as legend, and this game is a two hour children's book with buggy ladders, boring puzzles, and gruelingly slow movement speed. Buy pathologic instead.
 
Me When No Genghis

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 septembre 2020
This game is for lovers of the games with strange 3D mechanics and insignificant mechanic-wise story - like Stanley Parable and Antichamber. And it's not better than them.
There's your usual 3d world for stroll-simulation, except there's no colors and you must paint it starting with black - nothing more. You provided with some kind of tale for 10 yo child, so it's very insignificant.
It still might be ok, but i'm very disappointed, expecting at least some sort of Edith Finch level drama.

seshok
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2023
I don't recommend the game at this time because the keyboard controls cannot be rebound.

This game has no rebinding of keyboard controls. I expect fully released PC games (i.e. not early access) to have this for lots of reasons (e.g. accessibility, AZERTY keyboard users, personal preferences/comfort).

Controller support is good, but not everyone has or can use a controller. I've tried AutoHotKey, reWASD, and similar solutions, but they all have drawbacks.

I look forward to revisiting the game and this review when keyboard control rebinding is fully supported.
 
adeilt
1,781 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2023
The game is incompatible with modern systems. I have a good PC, and this is the only game I've ever had problems with. The frame rate drops to ridiculously low numbers and the camera lags a lot, especially when you get to chapter 2. Even on every lowest graphics setting it does not work. The game would be good, but I can't recommend this to anyone in it's state.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
11.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2020
Sorry for my poor English.
In my opinion the greatest advantage of What Remains of Edith Finch is the guidance for players,accurate ,clear and very easy to distinguish.As a player I never felt lost or confused in any part of the game,the guidance could always keep me in the right track.
I always believe that Edith Finch is the best game in guiding players,which is why i felt disappointed in this product.Surely there are scores of obvious marks all the way,like foot prints,golden units...But by contrast,the same patterns of the scenery made me easily get bored.Monochrome -I know that's the style you chose- but it merges every buildings and structures together,makes the swan hard to be seen(because swans are white),confused me with the path beneath me.
And the worst part is,the high contrast stings my eyes...
I don't like the balloon idea either.It's as conspicuous as the guidance marks so I often hesitated between keeping on the main track or turning my head to collect the balloon. That is OK in exploration games,but it's more disturbing than joyful in a game with a constant guidance system.

===============================
Following complaints are about Chapter 3.
Who the heck considered traveling across an extremely dark place and an extremely bright place over and over without fade-out effect to solve a puzzle is a cool idea???
Who came up with such an idea as using sudden flash to represent being shocked in an extremely dark place???
I feel deep pity for those players who have PSE.

Smooth Brain Official

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2022
这游戏应该是比较有趣的，讲了一个失去母亲的小孩子醒过来，发现妈妈没画完的大鹅出走了，然后追随着大鹅的足迹探索一个童话世界的故事。

无奈差评的原因是因为探索的方式对我个人来说很不适应：在游戏的开始阶段，玩家要在一个空白的世界里不断挥洒墨滴，来显示出周围物体的形状。

这其实是很有意思的玩法，但是偏偏对我来说造成了强烈的眩晕、想要呕吐的感觉.......实在难以继续游玩了，也许我之后可以坚持每天玩一会儿看完这个故事......

The game doesn't run smooth. I've played it for just half an hour. The game experience wasn't so impressive till now. But honestly, this game design is a good idea, so I'll try to finish playing it. But till now, it's not worth 90% of the good comments.
This review might change later. That's all.
/I love your games. Poor English. :)

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
20 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 septembre 2020
That isn't a good work because it's terrible quality, yeah, such terrible.What do you feel if you stay on the environment that just white and dark or white and light-blue for a long time? All right, it maybe full of aesthetic at first, but when I got used to it I just feel tired because the contrast is too strong or too low.What do you feel if the vine grow on everywhere that coincidentally you in a group of gorgeous and minimalist palace? All right, it maybe suitable if the zone is just a little because it's no doubt that everyone needs some green on life. But what about the vine is the way of traveling and across the group of palace? It will pretty strange and incredible. What do you feel if you in trouble with dark environment and you can't see what direction should you go? All right, it maybe be loved by anyone. But why some spiders is hided in it? Does it is a relaxing adventure game? The spider will kill you if arrive at the certain amount of hurting by them.What do you feel if you had seen a huge maze but the game is not allow you to tour in it on all process? All right, it maybe one symbol of this game but what the meaning of it? I don't know. And what core idea of it want to expose to every player? I don't know too.You just need to throw ink bubbles or water bubbles to explore in it, that's all. Throwing bubbles to recover the path is a good idea, but the duration also is short.So, whereas the duration of completing it is more than what remains of edith finch, but the letter is richer than it. Normal storyline maybe is the weakest aspect of it.

[BLK] Telu

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2023
This is a pretty fun and short puzzle game that anyone can play. Its gameplay mechanics are simple and enjoyable while not getting stale through the duration of the game, though it's the execution of the gameplay that truly makes it interesting.
The visuals complement the gameplay with equal simplicity, accompanied by excellent direction that tells a compelling story through both the speech and the scenery itself.
Just a good game all around.

Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2023
This is a game I played a long time ago. I didn't remember much though, because I was a little younger playing it on the PlayStation 3. Playing through it again was fantastic, because I barely remembered any of it, but I still had fond memories. It may not have the best replay value, but I'll still come back. Having played through it now, I would have bought it full price, despite how short it was (I 100% beat all achievements in 3.1 hours, even the super hard one where you can't use but 3 paint balls in the first part).

jade
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 décembre 2023
I love the concept for this game as it allows the player to reveal the level. That's how it started out, but then the theme quickly dissipated. The game ended up adding shadows to objects, which I thought was a really cool progression. After the shadows, it seemed that colors were just added to most of the objects. I wish the progressive addition of color continued throughout the game, so it built on itself between levels. A small gripe I have is not giving the sniper rifle toy until the player has found all the balloons. With the sniper rifle it makes hitting balloons much easier, but it is a fun toy to have. Giving the sniper rifle once all balloons have been found feels kind of pointless because finding all balloons was the last thing I did. There is an achievement that utilizes the sniper rifle, but it is very quick, so players are not able to experience the sniper rifle much unless they feel like replaying a level. Although there were some things that I griped about, I think the game is still fun and has an enjoyable story. Make sure you drink some water when you play!
 
Dormio_san

Ещё одна игра от создателей What Remains of Edith Finch - но тут уже всё не так интересно с тз сюжета и нарратива, занятная только геймплейно/визуальная концепция - в игре нет цвета, и для перемещения по миру (и понимания что нас собственно окружает), вы швыряем шары с краской которые разбиваясь об стены/пол и прочее красят их в условно чёрный цвет (потом конечно это всё чутка меняется и появляются тени в мире + новые механики, но базово всё так же). 2,5 часа

FeFe Lemon Squar
182 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2023
It's a fun, whimsical story-led video game. It's not quite worth the standard $20 in my opinion (I'd say $10 would suffice), but it was a sweet game.

Personally I'd say the story is a bit back and forth, sometimes it seems like it will lead a certain way but diverts to something maybe unexpected, and not necessarily in a beneficial way. The music and voice acting is lovely, and the different game mechanics with the paint can be fun, though a few times it just made things more frustrating rather than fun.

Overall, if you like first-person adventure games centered on story (walking-simulator, I suppose) then give this one a try.
 
friendlynightmares
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2023
Si vous avez deux heures de votre temps à consacrer à une petite expérience de jeu, comme on les appelle "artsy" alors foncez ! The Unfinished Swan a son petit lot de surprise, qui saura charmer les plus jeunes comme les grands. Une très jolie expérience, visuellement marquante avec quelques éléments simples.

J'ai adoré faire pousser toutes ces vignes, merci à l'équipe de Giant Sparrow pour ce bon moment. J'avais découvert le studio avec What Remains of Edith Finch, et je ne regrette pas de m'être intéressée à ce titre également. Bonne continuation aux développeurs-euses, et bon jeu à vous si vous lisez ces lignes !
 
Similicuir
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2023
I have yet to finish it (I'm currently stuck and I don't want to use a guide), so perhaps I should not write a review yet. I finished it and got all achievements (some are a bit frustrating).
Judging by what I've seen so far, I recommend it. However, you should attentively consider a couple things, if you want to play it:
- overwhelming whiteness and brightness, general lack of clearly discernible contours and other factors, found especially but not exclusively in the first levels, can give you ocular migraine;
- this game is bad for you if you suffer even a bit from Acrophobia. You will go up A LOT; dangle from under bridges, and other funny things. Falling from any height can't "kill" your character, but still it feels very bad.
For these reasons, I can only play it a bit at a time, before it gives me anxiety and a headache. But I still like it.

Funny trivia: if you shoot the sparkly balloon in the forest with the sniper rifle, while it's on the ground or on water, it explodes, leaving you in darkness.

125 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 octobre 2023
很新颖的玩法，自己一点一点染色这个世界，但是我真的玩的头晕，晕的受不了，每次能坚持半个小时已经很不错了，本来想全成就的，但是我真的克服不了这个晕眩。
通关几个小时就能做到，但是就这几个小时，我断断续续玩了快一个月才玩完，玩半个小时，难受半天，一想到我要难受，我就要做好心理准备才能继续玩这个游戏。
大家如果要玩的话，要做好心理准备。
这是一种美丽的晕眩。
而且没有中文版，里面的寓言故事都是英文的，虽然不影响游戏的进行，但是我有些看不太懂，很久没看单词+说的是寓言故事，果然还是想知道这个故事说的啥。

l4Zerti
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2023
The Unfinished Swan is a relatively quick adventure puzzle. There isn't anything particularly hard about the game but it can be extremely disorienting at times. I must mention the game isn't without it's charms. The story and narration are very engaging. In fact, you may have picked up on the connections to What Remains of Edith Finch. A lot more depth is added to the storyline once those connections are made. The game is definitely worth the $4.04 I got it for in a bundle, just don't give up on the first level, The Garden, it does get better.

很有意义的游戏。虽然前两章因为3D引擎晕得受不了但还是坚持玩下来了，玩到今天开最后一章的时候甚至通宵回来还喝了一点点酒催眠但完全没有觉得晕。从第一章的探索黑白，到攀爬藤蔓，到黑夜漫游，到亲手构建阶梯......一步步踏上心目中的灯塔，每一次曲折的前进都会给屏幕前的我带来惊喜乃至震撼，这也是为什么我即便是晕到冷汗直冒也要走到最后的原因。就像是歌曲《time to pretend》0.9倍速度里的配文写到，“世上无难事，只要肯攀登”。每一个捉摸不定的梦想可以是远在天边的灯火，也是可以探手捉住的裙角。不知道你的梦，是否可以成为你辗转反侧时的救赎。

Kejsarepingvin
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2023
Any deeper meaning or metaphor was lost on me, but the game was still fun
From the same people that made 'What Remains of Edith Finch'; The Unfinished Swan is equally surreal and artsy but this time is more of a puzzle adventure title than a story-rich walking sim. The game revolves around a core mechanic of splattering paint to reveal the world around you, and each chapter mixes this up slightly to keep it engaging over it’s fairly short run time.

Like many of these types of games (simple puzzle games built around a unique core mechanic like 'Superliminal', or 'The Stanley Parable'), it has a faint impression of a tech demo moulded into a game rather than a fully fledged game but nonetheless I enjoyed my time with it.
 
ChalkWhite

278 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 aout 2023
El juego es tranquilo, tiene jugabilidad y visuales creativos y es un buen predecesor para What Remains of Edith Finch. Sin embargo tengo una queja y es una muy grande y es acerca del rendimiento, no sé si es mi computadora pero hay veces donde el juego se crashea o ralentiza sus FPS en especial en el primer capitulo cuando lanzo las manchas negras, y sinceramente eso es molesto, y me sorprende como un juego que salió después corre mejor que un titulo del 2012, pero aun así, si te gustó mucho What Remains of Edith Finch al punto de considerarlo tu juego favorito recomendaría bajar las expectativas un poquito, dado que el juego es más un experimento visual y narrativo que una historia que intenta conmoverte, pero si buscas un titulo chill para explorar un mundo visualmente maravilloso y aparte tienes una PC más potente te lo recomendo. Al final del día es elección de cada uno

Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2023
（个人）8.8分，挺有创意的游戏，叙事和氛围渲染比较出色。
没玩过这种泼墨跑图的玩法，开头比较惊艳，童话感比较强（包括菜单翻书这种感觉），但是感觉一切都服务于剧情流程，导致在玩法上有些单调，虽然很多关卡的设计都很巧妙，动画也不错，但我总感觉开发空间还很大，还能有更好玩的玩法，总而言之就是游戏性不足。游戏内容不算多，也不难，但如果要全收集可能要花一些功夫。

GuiCraft
112 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2023
Yeah, I would say it's a nice game to play, if you get the game on sale. The storyline is sweet & keeps you playing to figure things out. I like that the game doesn't penalize you for making an error. It's a fun world to see unfold & a fun way to spend a day or few hours in. I don't think you can get all achievements in the first go around ~ so if you're going for achievements, you'll need to play it again and I highly recommend getting some toys in the Toy option to help make the game play quicker the second go around. Also, there's a good site that has some tips & walk throughs of game to help if you're going for achievements or you get frustrated but you really don't need it for first time playing it... just have fun exploring it!
 
SmilingOma333
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2023
The Unfinished Swan is a game that I go back to multiple times. Not only is it a game that is so simple in mechanics, but it is a game that is simple in story. It is a perfect game for when you just want something quick and easy to play and I recommend this game for younger audiences.

When looking at the gameplay, it is generally super simple, you just walk around the world, throwing paint/water balls and solve tiny puzzles to progress in story and in the world. Anyone can play this game and quickly get the hang of it, there is nothing overly complicated about this game. If you have young children as well, I also recommend this game because the style is also simple. The cartoonish feel of the artwork and how simple the story is can keep children entertained until the very end.

The story itself is also so cute and heartwarming, but also has a deeper meaning. Everyone can take something away from this game, young or old. It is a story that I find, despite being in my adult years, so simple and encouraging. I recommend this game for people who don't play video games often and want to get into them, those with young children, or those who just want something quick and cozy to play. Giant Sparrow has also done some amazing work in What Remains of Edith Finch, another game I heavily recommend for more mature audiences, such as teens and young adults.

Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2023
Una historia infantil de jugabilidad simple que funciona como spinoff de un personaje de "What Remains of Edith Finch".

Algunos logros pueden requerir seguir una guía pero se puede platinar sin despeinarse.

Recomendado para que lo juegue un niño chico, o si te gustó el anterior título y querés algo más de lore.
 
Kaiser
520 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2023
尽管是极短的一段旅途，但游戏中所展现的那令人惊叹的创意，大概是我一辈子都忘不掉的。
游戏整体看起来就像是在翻阅一本童话书一般，故事的过场也是翻页的形式，我是相当喜欢童话的，如此美好的故事在读完之后总归是能睡个好觉的吧。
正如同故事的主角一样，虽然经历了一场奇异的，有时舒缓有时惊险的，有时紧张有时开心的旅途，最后总能迎来一个温馨的结局。
这没什么不好的。
祝愿大家也能睡个好觉，做个好梦吧。

2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2023
This game is super fun and charming (assuming you are in to walking simulators). It has an engaging story and some fun puzzles to keep things interesting. Plus the paint splatter mechanic is pretty unique. Though I will be honest and say that 15$ is pretty steep for a game this short. It's abut 2 hours to beat and maybe an extra hour if you get all of the collectibles and achievements. Wait for it to go on sale for 10$ or less, and then I'd say it's it's well worth it.
 
DaRootBeer1231
206 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juin 2023
Kaufempfehlung, aber nur, wenn es im Angebot ist. Ich hatte es für 3,74 Euro während eines Sales gekauft. Für den Preis war das Spiel eine nette, kurze Unterhaltung für Zwischendurch. Nichts weltbewegendes, nichts, das man erneut anpacken würde. Aus dem Grundkonzept, Farbbälle zu schmeißen, hätte man mehr machen können. Während im ersten Kapitel schwarze Bälle zur Orientierung in der nahezu komplett in Weiß gehaltenen Umgebung dienen, hat man im zweiten Kapitel Wasserbälle, die Ranken 'anlocken'. Das war's im Prinzip. Das Konzept hätte man problemlos erweitern können, wie z. B. mit Feuer- oder Eisbällen.

Positiv:

- interessant anmutendes Konzept, dass man sich seinen Weg 'ausmalen' muss, um zu sehen, wo man entlang kann, jedoch...

Negativ:

- findet es leider schnell sein Ende, vermutlich um für die kurze Spieldauer Abwechslung einzubringen
- langsame Laufgeschwindigkeit
- kein Standard-Autofeuern. Gerade in Kapitel 2 klickt man sich den Finger kaputt
- bis auf Sammelgegenstände (Ballons), die man vielleicht übersehen hat, kein Wiederspielwert, den es liegt alles praktisch auf dem Weg

Neutral:

- Spielzeit für den ersten Durchgang liegt bei 2-3 Stunden. Für das, was geboten wird, absolut ausreichend.
- Story ist zwar gefühlt belanglos, aber kein totaler Reinfall und wird nett präsentiert
- Errungenschaften sind gerade mit den freispielbaren Zusatzfunktionen recht einfach zu erspielen. Eine Errungenschaft verlangt im Prinzip, dass man sich den allerersten Abschnitt gut einprägt, um diesen quasi blind abschließen zu können. Dank Kapitelauswahl nach Spielende (oder vorher freigespielt) muss das gesamte Game nicht erneut gespielt werden, um alles zu holen
 
SubarashiiSensei
606 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2023
Grając w tę grę o niedokończonym łabędziu, ciągle odnosiłem wrażenie, że nie tylko łabędź jest niedokończony, ale i też sama gra. Zaczynając od rozgrywki, to polega ona na zwiedzaniu krain oraz poznawania historii. W zasadzie to wszystko. Samej gry w grze jest mało, bo jedynie co robimy przez całą grę to strzelamy kulkami poznając w ten sposób teren, czasami otworzymy jakieś drzwi czy pozbieramy ukryte balony. Dopiero pod koniec gry napotykamy się na nową mechanikę tworzenia bloków. Co do historii to wnioskując po jej narracji, prawdopodobnie jest skierowana do młodszych odbiorców, czego nie powiedziałbym o samej grze, bo w jednym z rozdziałów gra zamienia się w horror, gdzie ogromne pająki chcą zabić gracza, gdy tylko ten pozostanie na dłużej w ciemności. Kiedy uruchomiłem grę po raz pierwszy, to zauważyłem, że podczas uruchamiania gry widnieje napis, że gra pierwotnie była stworzona na konsolę Playstation 4, no i niestety tak jest. Gra jest bardzo słabo przeportowana na Windowsa, co bardzo odczuwałem, gdyż miałem problem, że czułość rozglądania była zmienna w zależności od mojej orientacji oraz dodatkowo bardzo często jak się rozglądałem, to nagle przeskakiwał mi cały obraz, jakby ktoś chwycił moją myszkę i chciał mi pokazać, jak szybko może ona przejechać po moim biurku. Już nawet przed rozpoczęciem gry miałem problem z wyłączeniem synchronizacji pionowej, bo tak naprawdę gra ma identycznie podpisane włączenie, jak i wyłączenie synchronizacji, co spowodowało, że nie wiedziałem, kiedy jest włączona, a kiedy nie. Napisy od dialogów potrafiły wychodzić poza ekran gry, a i też zdarzyło się, że gra zdecydowała się cała wywalić i musiałem ją uruchamiać ponownie. Ogólnie grę polecam jedynie osobom, które chcą pozwiedzać naprawdę pięknie wykonane krainy, bo dla samej rozgrywki nie warto.
 
Polythron
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Évaluation publiée le 19 mai 2023
This game had an incredible start, I really enjoyed the first level
however the gimmick of being in a plain white room and needing to paint it to see was quickly discarded by the 3rd zone and became another generic puzzle game with throwing paint to push buttons to open doors.

The later levels were either fully lit with shading or mostly darkness were you basically had to jump around randomly
removing the need to paint hardly anything.

My other main issue was the performance in some levels. Despite having a good computer I was still getting 15fps in some areas with super laggy mouse inputs.

Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2023
Toda una obra en sí que no puedo más que recomendar sin ver nada antes del juego. Piérdete en los lienzos y crea la historia mediante pintura. Dentro reseña!

Estamos ante un walking simulator cuya historia presenta a un chico llamado Monroe que tendrá que descubrir la historia tras un cuadro inacabado y un rey de antaño. La historia es simple pero llega, más ♥♥♥ voces en castellano magníficas.

La narración se hace tanto visualmente, como por una voz en off narrando los cuadros, como por los propios personajes. El juego dura alrededor de unas dos horas durante los 4 capítulos que tiene, ♥♥♥ escenarios variados.

Las mecánicas son saltar y lanzar o disparar bolas infinitas de pinturas, ♥♥♥ las que verás por donde ir y descubrirás cosas. Tendremos unos globos como coleccionables que ♥♥♥ ellos podremos comprar modificadores para pasarnos otra vez la historia.

Una mecánica única, diferente a lo visto, una narración sencilla pero muy personal y unos gráficos muy bonitos por los que ver el paisaje que vas creando. Poco más puedo decir, es de mis indies favoritos y deberíais jugarlo sin ver nada antes. Gracias por leer! <3

Évaluation publiée le 14 mai 2023
ナイスアイディア
一度、過去にプレイしたものの３D酔いがひどく断念。プレイするならばゲーム酔いになる覚悟を決めてプレイしてほしい。1周目クリアにかかった時間は二時間程度なので、気合で乗り切れなくもない。
操作は簡単。チャプターごとにギミックが変化するため飽きはなかった。白い世界にインク玉をぶつけて、空間把握していくというアイディアは素晴らしいと思う。ゲーム開始時の掴みはばっちり。導線も一本道で迷うことは少ないが、ギミックを解くのにひらめきを必要とする場面が何度かある。ストーリーも悪くはないが、意外とあっけなく終わるのでストーリー目当てで買うことはあまりおすすめしない。
すこし変わったゲーム体験がしたい人には、プレイ時間がコンパクトなこともありオススメできる。なにはともあれ、３D酔いには気を付けてほしい。
 
amakana
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2023
Known for its innovative gameplay and enchanting story, The Unfinished Swan shares a creative lineage with the critically acclaimed What Remains of Edith Finch, as both games were developed by the same studio.

The game's unique art design is one of its most striking features. Players begin in a completely white space, armed with only a paintbrush that shoots black paint. By splattering paint around the environment, players reveal the hidden world around them and navigate through the story. This minimalist approach to visuals creates a sense of wonder and discovery as players uncover the game's world, piece by piece.

The Unfinished Swan follows the story of Monroe, a young boy chasing after a swan that has escaped from one of his late mother's unfinished paintings. As he journeys through the mysterious, uncolored world, Monroe learns about the eccentric King who created the realm and the stories behind its inhabitants. The narrative is whimsical and touching, resonating with players of all ages.

Similar to What Remains of Edith Finch, The Unfinished Swan places a strong emphasis on storytelling and atmosphere. Both games feature a unique narrative structure that encourages exploration and discovery. The Unfinished Swan, however, takes a more lighthearted approach, immersing players in a charming and whimsical world, in contrast to the darker, more introspective themes of Edith Finch.

Gameplay in The Unfinished Swan is centered around exploration and puzzle-solving. As players progress through the game, they encounter a variety of mechanics that build upon the core paint-splattering mechanic, such as manipulating water and shadows to navigate the environment. These gameplay elements keep the experience fresh and engaging, while still maintaining the focus on story and atmosphere.

In conclusion, The Unfinished Swan is a delightful and imaginative journey through a whimsical world. Its innovative gameplay, enchanting story, and unique art design create an unforgettable experience that will charm players of all ages. For fans of What Remains of Edith Finch, The Unfinished Swan offers a similarly immersive storytelling experience while exploring a more lighthearted and fantastical realm.

Kabardino
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2023
Completionist info at the bottom. Mild spoilers in this review. Rating 8/10

The Unfinished Swan is a charming game which tells a very cute story. If that kind of thing appeals to you, you will have a good time with this game. However, if you are looking for really anything else, this game is likely not going to be your thing.

The Unfinished Swan is a self-described “interactive children’s book” and this is about as perfect of a description as you could ask for. The player plays as Monroe, a young child whose mother has recently passed away. Monroe is given one of his late mother’s unfinished paintings, his favorite, the unfinished swan. One day, Monroe wakes up and finds the swan has escaped its painting and, upon chasing it, the player finds himself in a mysterious painted world through which Monroe/the player chases the swan who always remains one step ahead.

The design of the game is really its strongest selling point, even, in my opinion, above the narrative. It is, as was already implied, reminiscent of a children’s storybook, but with the added delight of three dimensions, which is a unique and pleasant experience. The different vistas of the game are very striking as the game transitions from painted forest to enormous castle to dark forest. Each area is unique and memorable, albeit quite short.

Mechanically, the core gameplay is standard and, arguably, boring. Actual movement in The Unfinished Swan doesn’t extend much past simply pressing WASD and the occasional left-click. But to criticize the game for this would be narrow-minded. This game is, fundamentally, an interactive story, and little effort went in to any sort of dynamic movement system. Instead, The Unfinished Swan does have a few tricks, gimmicks if you will, that it introduces from level to level. These include growing vines, moving light sources, and buildable blocks, all of which play a part in different levels to various degrees. These additions keep the game from getting too stale while adding a little bit of a challenge to the player, elevating the game from being a walking-simulator to an actual puzzle game.

Finally, the story of the game is well-done. While The Unfinished Swan has more gameplay than many similar games, and therefore doesn’t have to rely on its story quite as much as other games in its genre, much of the final impact of the game comes down to how well the story is executed. The story, and its conclusion, determine the taste which is left in the player mouth once the game is finished and forgotten. And I think the flavor that remains after this game is sweet. I said before that The Unfished Swan is a very cute game, but perhaps charming is a better word. Its story is a very human one, surprisingly deep for the limited time the story has and, by the end, the player who is playing this game for its atmosphere will be left satisfied by it.

And really, that is all there is to say about the game. It is a charming experience which has excellent visuals, some interesting mechanics/puzzles, and a satisfying story. It is a short game and shouldn’t take much more than a lazy afternoon to complete. But be warned, the story and world might stay in your mind a good while longer than that.

Completionist Information: (Difficulty – 4/10)(Fun – 6/10)(Time: 2-3 hours)

The Unfinished Swan is a quick game and has a level select which allows collection of all of the game’s collectibles, which are balloons, easily and quickly. Doing this, however, will essentially require two playthroughs of the game as the player is likely to miss balloons in every level unless you are being very careful, which I don’t really recommend. When playing through just for collectables, you can go very quickly if you know what you are doing and the chapter select is quite robust/extensive.

The hardest achievement is one in which you must basically play the first level of the game completely blind for the most part. This is more tedious than challenging, but if you follow a video guide closely, it isn’t too bad, just annoying.

Overall, not an overly fun game to complete (it’s not really made for challenge anyways), but also not that bad either. Fine all around.
 
Moose

There was indeed a swan that required additional work. 10/10

This is a re-release of a game that originally came out for PS3 back in 2012. The core mechanic is cool and well executed, and it's backed by some good narration. It doesn't have quite the staying power of What Remains of Edith Finch, but it feels like the devs recognized that and made the game significantly shorter and simpler to match.

ボリュームは少な目だがまったり進められるのでオススメ
